Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Hockey and Football”
Reviews.Author: Phill N
Reviews.Content: Very good location for Hockey and Football fans, but that is also it's downside. Hotel is very centrally located with easy access to just about anything in Vancouver. Rooms come a bit scarce during Hockey season as I found out. My room was clean, comfortable and basic. Bathroom was rather small and cramped. Toiletries and towels were readily available. The room contained a mini fridge which is nice so you don't have to rely on the $2.25 price for a beverage from the vending machines. There are several 7-Elevens and stores within comfortable walking distance for all your needs. One view from the room was of the Stadium and the other, of an alley and rooftop of adjacent building. Which wasn't a major concern. Elevators can be tricky sometimes because the card reader fails quite often I found in my 4 day stay at the hotel. Great bar area, and the other attached bar is great for watching sports, especially hockey. But get there early for there is standing room only once a Canucks game is on. Staff was friendly, lobby was clean and open, and free WiFi was a definite plus. I definitely would recommend this hotel if you're needing a clean, comfortable room within in close proximity of the stadium and arena, and also a good choice for a centralised hotel in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Choice (If you have any need for Internet access...)”
Reviews.Author: room317
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for a week with several colleagues. At least 80% of the time, the Internet service was down completely. When it was working, it was slow and constantly timing out. Colleagues on several floors in various parts of the north tower had the same experience every day all week. Tech support from the service provider, Liveport, was useless and basically amounted to "it looks fine on this end." The hotel staff were indifferent and the general manager dodged all attempts to contact him about the issue. If you choose to book this hotel, do not expect working Internet access. Personal communication and online work of any kind --even sending an email-- is all but impossible here, and the staff and management do not care. This is particularly troublesome if you are visiting from outside of Canada and reply on Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Sandman close for Ice hockey and football”
Reviews.Author: Simonosb
Reviews.Content: Simple room clean and presentable bed comfortable pillows ok, picked due to the closeness of Rogers arena, it is literally a 3 min walk away Only 5 min walk to the tube station the other way. Unlike other comments I heard no extra notice due to the hockey match. only neg was the wifi was very weak on the 9th floor. Moxies for food attached didnt use so cant comment. Would I stay again yes

Reviews.Title: “Sandman City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Hartifacts
Reviews.Content: Great location for the Rodgers Arena...subway, great restaurants and neighborhoods, just a short walk...Passion 2012 Vancouver Awesome !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location for arena and stadium stays but just an ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: lulubelle45
Reviews.Content: We stayed here years ago when we won the accommondation. This time we got a double room for $99 as we were going to a concert at Rogers arena. It is located an easy walk of 2 blocks to either Rogers or BC Place. Check in was smooth and since we had a large truck the parking attendants let us park in valet temporarily until we checked in then directed us into the correct lot for over height. $15 to park which is standard in downtown Vancouver. The room was clean though alittle run down, broken shelf in bathroom and poorly renovated and not enough towels for 3 people. We did find 2 pool towels in the dresser. As the kids wanted to swim before the concert(we were traveling with 3 others) we headed down to the pool. Good thing we read the directions as its confusing to find. We arrived to a big disappointment. The pool was fine, very deep in fact though the kids are teens, but the hot tub was cordoned off and under construction. Would have been nice to have known prior by a sign at the desk or in room. There is also no seating to watch the kids, had to sit on the stairs. This could do with improving. The elevators are extremely slow, and as we were on the 9th floor stairs were only an option going down. Waited 3 to return home after the concert as this hotel is one of the top choices for its location. In fact you have to sign a waiver on event nights for complaints and damage. Our only noise complaint was the stairwell door slamming shut, as there was no ice machine on our floor so people used the stairs to go up to the empty ice machine. The 7th floor had a working one. Beds were comfy and we were able to leave our truck till 2 pm though we left earlier. This hotel offered free wifi slow but at least it was free!!!! No free breakfast though. The restaurants were a bit pricy so we drove to a restaurant for brunch instead. The pros outweighs the cons so I would still come back here if going to concerts or hockey games but elsewhere if I'm in Vancouver otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Another plain jane stay”
Reviews.Author: Nolpreen
Reviews.Content: I do in fact like to stay at Sandman Downtown Vancouver as convenient BUT that being said the last 2 of 3 stays there the hot tub was under maintenance and shut down each time and after a very long stressful trip to Van cause of terrible roads etc it was the first thing I wanted to use but not available. And when you write the hotel I do expect any type of return message but NADA. That does not agree with me a lot and makes me think. And in the am is it too much trouble to have a hot shower or bath without it being just luke warm? That was also disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the game”
Reviews.Author: sleepy_nate
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sandman to attend a Vancouver Canucks game, ended up turning into a weekend getaway in Vancouver. Sandman is the perfect location if you're going to a hockey game or football game, both BC Place and Rogers Arena are steps away. Lots of places to eat, shopping is nearby, and lots to check out pedestrian style. We stayed in a Standard Queen room, ended up on the 12th floor. I liked the high floor, had a nice view of the surrounding towers and city, and also the newly re-done BC Place lights are nice at night. Room was comfortable and clean, LCD TV was nice (although this is almost standard fare nowadays). It could've used a couple extra towels and the bathroom vanity did not have much room for toiletries, but these are small quibbles. The main thing that was not fun was the thermostat for the room didn't work. There was an auxiliary heater in the room (I guess for that purpose?), but still made it difficult to regulate the temperature in the room. Figured it wasn't worth trying to ask for a different room as we knew they were sold out for the game anyways. Other than that, a comfortable stay. Front desk staff was very helpful and courteous, it felt like they were really listening to you and not just going through the motions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sports/theatre in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: island_m0m
Reviews.Content: With its proximity to Rogers arena and Queen Elizabeth Theatre, the Sandman is in the perfect location. Room rates very decent - $109 gets you a basic room with a bed. Good for an overnight when attending an event. A little more $ might get you larger quarters. It's right on the corner of Cambie and Georgia so can't be missed. Parking is secured underground for $15 - cheaper than any of the event parking costs. Elevators are also secure using your room pass. Decor is updated. Bathroom (toilet and tub) is very small and hard to close the door. Vanity/sink is separate, which I like. Check-in was very easy. On arrival the noise from the bar can seem boisterous with hockey fans. But upstairs I heard not a peep from my 6th floor room and you wouldn't know you were right downtown. My only complaint was it was hard to get a hot shower. It took a long time for the water to heat up and even when it did it was only warm.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Mike J
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is right Downtown. You can walk to most tourist locations. The Sky train and city buses are close by for other locations. Room was good. We were upgraded to a double Queen on arrival. Security was good as you needed a room key to use elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Sandman Visit”
Reviews.Author: J R
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not difficult to find. We were coming from Grand Forks. Upon arrival, parking was a little difficult. We drove a truck and parking was not easy. Our room was average for the rate we got. One queen bed, quite comfortable and a couch. The room was clean. There was a coffee maker, with tea. The television service was great. The only downfall was on checkout, we found a ticket on the truck stating that we had to pay for our parking because our ticket was not placed on the proper place on the dash. The desk staff were friendly, not overly helpful. The view was okay, BC Place was quite spectacular. There was sort of a dreary view of a cigarette-butt-scattered roof area with lots of traffic from employees on smoke breaks. We had a room near the elevators which was a bit noisy. All in all not a bad stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and inexpensive, a few things to watch out for”
Reviews.Author: YVR_guestservices
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here after having to move out when unexpected work had to be done on our condo. We were quite pleased to get a very good rate despite booking same-day and that on a night when a hockey game was on. Rooms are clean, and everything's in good repair. Lighting in the room could be better; the desk was not a great one at which to work and there was only one reading lamp beside the bed. Finding a place to plug in rechargers for the iPhones and iPad necessitated a lot of poking around behind immoveable furniture. As we had a pet we had to stay on floor 4, which meant we had a dreary "view" of an inaccessible, cigarette-butt-scattered roof area and a retaining wall. On our first stay we were right by the elevators, which meant a lot of noise from the ice machine, and from the hockey fans coming back. A lot of partying and pot smoking by others on our floor. Maintaining a comfortable temperature in the room was a constant challenge. Elevators extremely busy at peak times, resulting in long waits.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: WossVegas
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a bad rep. but was not our experience. Everyone said your staying there? but I heard it had recently been redone and it was cheap and close to the hockey game so I booked it. so glad we did, it is rated as a 3 star but I think that should be updated to a 5 star, from check in under cyrstal chandeliers on marble floors, right down to the plush robes waiting on our comfy beds! Excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Central and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Liz S
Reviews.Content: The Sandman was the first hotel we stayed in for our 3 month long trip through Canada, US and Fiji. We stayed here twice because we went to Whistler for a week. It's location is fantastic, walking distance to the main area in Vancouver and the hop on hop off buses stop right out in front. The food at the restaurant was nice and had great food. The service was good. But being from Australia we weren't use to staff asking how our meal was every 5 secs It got a little annoying especially since most of the time I had a full mouth. The lounge down stairs was great if you got the right person. Katie from Toronto (sorry I can't remember her last name) Was FANTASTIC! We loved her and made sure we tipped her big. The other ladies who served me were not anywhere near as good. The front desk people we always smiling and happy to help. If I asked for information about an attraction etc they would help out which is more then I can say for a lot of other places we stayed at. the second time we checked in they upgraded us to a larger room which was fantastic and it had a fridge so we could store milk and save money by having breakfast in the room. The room is what you need a bed, toilet and shower. But there was not much room to put our suitcases. But really how many people stay there have 4 large suitcases and hand luggage. the only problem we had with the room was the double glazing was not sealed properly so we had to crank the heat all the time. Apart from that the room was clean and welcoming every night we came back.

Reviews.Title: “Not safe area”
Reviews.Author: traveller1216
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sandman Hotel Vancouver City Center for two nights in mid January 2012. I removed all my belongings from my car and stored the GPS in the glovebox before parking my car in the underground paid parking lot with security and limited entry. When I checked out of the hotel and got to my car, I found my car to be damaged. Somebody had broken into my car through the driver's side window (smashed to pieces) and stolen the GPS from the glove box. I came upstairs and told the hotel about the incident. Front desk told me that such incidents are rare in the area and in the hotel. I later find out from people working in the parking lot and nearby area that such incidents occur about once a week in the hotel!!! Furthermore, the manager told me that the cameras were not functioning when I had my car parked and the hotel is not liable for the damage to my car despite the secured parking lot. His words "security is for honest people and doesn't stop the vagrants from breaking into vehicles." Total car damage > $2000, which my car insurance company is partly paying. Hotel wouldn't cover part of my bill or provide a voucher so that I can get over this terrible experience. Bottom line: Don't stay in this hotel or nearby area. If you must, don't park your car in the so called secured paid parking lot. This warning is especially true for travelers from outside British Columbia.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel for the money, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dragontwin
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff, room, check in and check out, and pool area were just fine. There were a few inconveniences such as fuzzy cable, no "do not disturb" door hanger, slow elevators and dirty windows. For the money, it was a perfectly fine hotel with a great location, and the water pressure in the shower was great. The Shark Club wasn’t as hot as its website totes. The food was yummy, albeit expensive, and it was completely dead on a Saturday night, so in the future I’ll plan to have cocktails somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good rate, but do not expect more than that”
Reviews.Author: broccolily
Reviews.Content: It was first time for me to stay this hotel as I always stay at YWCA next door to this hotel. Well, I don’t know if I chose this hotel next time… < Advantage > Good location to Skytrain station (China Town/Stadium) and also very close to city center (a few blocks away). Nice room (seems renovation was done not so long ago). < Disadvantage > Super slow response to inquiry e-mail and dumb reply by asking the information, which I have already clearly mentioned, also giving wrong information such as airport shuttle bus, which is not operated any more in winter time. Attitude of front desk staff was terrible (not professional, not friendly at all). Complimentary coffee was provided on the first day only and coffee machine was not cleaned during room making (used coffee pouch was left as it was).

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff were terrible”
Reviews.Author: LIVINGlifewithGI
Reviews.Content: The hotel it self was great, really nice clean rooms but the front desk staff were really rude and never had the time of day not all the staff I did see some nice ones but the two that I dealt with were very rude and couldn't careless about customer service, I would even be walking past to go outside and the manager would be talking about his personal life and everyone in the lobby could hear, The internet also would cut out so you would have to go sit in lobby to use the internet. I would never go back to this hotel because of that, there were so many other hotels that have same price and great service I wouldn't even bother going back to Sandman Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Effective hotel near centre”
Reviews.Author: johnboog
Reviews.Content: The Sandman hotel is getting on a bit, late 70's design that needs some new paint here and there. But a good location next to stadium, near Chinatown and go for a good breakfast to Medina Cafe on Beatty Street nearby (see separate review). Efficient hotel with parking and no frills service. Two good bars. It works, value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and accomodation”
Reviews.Author: tonestar24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a Contiki tour, and was very impressed with the hotel. We stayed here at the start and end of our tour so both stays were great. The location is excellent, the staff were fantastic and the hotel is really nice, rooms and lobby. The only downside was the elevators took forever and especially when you have many tour groups rolling through, the line was long getting upstairs once we were dropped off with our luggage. The wifi worked great, breakfast was nice and overall it was a pleasant stay. I will definitely stay here again, it was really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Long term stay”
Reviews.Author: franco b
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sandman City Centre for approxiamately 50 days in October and November and the stay was very comfortable. The staff treats you very well and responds quickly to any needs. The restaurant and bar staff are personable, efficient and friendly. The close proximity to all downtown areas make this a great hotel location. I would certainly come back and recommend this hotel to business travellers on long term stays in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and price.”
Reviews.Author: Spencer W
Reviews.Content: For less than $100, we got a hotel that is the closest hotel to Rogers Arena for a hockey game. This place caters to that crowd. Check in was easy, parking is located underground in a secured parking garage via room key, and access to the rooms also via room key in the elevators, so you definitely feel secure. The room was rather small, but clean and in good working order. We got a corner room facing the arena, so we always had our blinds open enjoying the city view. The one downside of the room was the bathroom was so small that you had to squeeze in next to the toilet in order to close the door. Just a little pain for a great priced room. There was also a great sports bar, The Shark Club, right in the hotel that was great for pre-game activities with drink and food specials. We hung out there both before and after the game. If staying in the downtown area, you definitely cannot beat this price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: LX9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice and i will definately be back, It has an excellent location i walked everywhere, the shark bar at the hotel was a favourite great food great atmosphere all sports on the big screen just awesome!! easy to get to for international travellers, from the airport catch the train to vancouver central, when you come out to the street walk 4 or 5 blocks to the right and you are there and only $7 fantastic. The hotel staff were great and helped me out with everything i needed, very very happy.

Reviews.Title: “One nite, no issues”
Reviews.Author: TonySeattleSeattleWA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one nite, checked in quickly, had a reservation for a queen, and they said they were not too busy and moved us into a room with a King. Clean room, everything worked. Asked to be placed away from the nite club, so we were not bothered by the noise, no problem doing so. Didnt order from the hotel restuarants, per prior reviews, but in downtown Vancouver, there are plenty of other choices. I have stayed here before, the pricing was good, and would not hestitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - not the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelstar51
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights in September 2011. Room on 11th floor so not disturbed by noise from the Shark Bar. Room poor - absolutely no drawer space so couldn't unpack properly. Carpet was wet at side of one of the beds (leak from bathroom) - obviously not checked by maid service. Reported and offered a room change without question. Ate at Moxie's restaurant both nights - food and drink and service fine. Hotel lifts are supposed to be key card secured but they aren't. Only 2 lifts available which are inadequate for the number of people in the hotel so you had a long wait every time you wanted to use one. Work had been done on our floor by contractors and the mess left not cleaned up. Some noise from other hotel guest in the early hours. Hotel location is fine for easy walking to main shopping areas. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, well located, a bit dingy”
Reviews.Author: RoyalSilk
Reviews.Content: The main thing going for this hotel is the rooms are available at a reasonable rate and it is very well located, right in the centre of Vancouver and close (four blocks) to Vancouver City Centre on the Skytrain. A number of grocery stores are located close by, as well as many other amenities. Budget rent a car is about two blocks away and Pacific Car Rentals are also close by. The rooms are small and would benefit from some better lighting in them, and the rather strange dark decor adds to the impression the place is a bit dingy. But the staff were very friendly and helpful and overall I would recommend this for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Location Isn't Everything”
Reviews.Author: Anise76
Reviews.Content: So, nice location downtown, but if you're hoping for a quiet, relaxing stay, this isn't the place for you. Our room was right above the Shark Club Bar, which pounds music out day and night, meaning that sleep was an impossibility. There are always dodgy blokes hanging around outside the front door, asking for money, and it's very intimidating. The rooms, however, are comfortable, with the beds large and soft enough to sink into, without being TOO soft. The bathroom, however, was tiny, dingy, and had some damage to the bath. The hotel-supplied hairdryer blew up while we were there, and reception provided a replacement immediately. The food in the M-Lounge was great, and the Beef Dip in the Shark Bar was fantastic. However, the bad things outweighed the good, and it didn't make our list of places to consider for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rogers Arena and BC Place next door.”
Reviews.Author: Ydnar
Reviews.Content: With parking on event nights running twenty bucks alone, this property is a great value when booked early and at a discounted rate. Even if your plans do not include a visit to BC Place or Rogers Arena, this is a great location in downtown Vancouver. Walking distance to numerous restaurants, shopping opportunities and the Skytrain, this is a super location to experience all that downtown has to offer, and at a reasonable price. I was in the South Tower and found the rooms small - not even a closet - but the layout was okay and pretty much everything required was at my disposal. Did not try the internet connection so I can't comment on that. Bedding was comfortable, clean, and no problems there. My air-conditioning unit didn't seem to work but the window actually opened (and it was the end of October so not sweltering). Check-in/out was quick, accurate, and uneventful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay when you visit the Big City and the Canucks!”
Reviews.Author: silverdollar35
Reviews.Content: Great value - you're in the heart of the Canuck Zone. Clean comfortable rooms, well stocked, quiet and within walking distance to shopping, the game, theatre and dining.

Reviews.Title: “This was a real home from home”
Reviews.Author: BaldingJoseph
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in the Sandman Hotel on West Georgia Street. The staff were really friendly and welcoming. Every need was met. The room was kept really clean and tidy. We could come and go with family members coming in to visit. The hotel is well situated for the harbour, Gastown, Chinatown and the two large stadia are nearby. The little False Creek ferries are close by as are the buses and the Skytrain. It was our best hotel stay ever.

Reviews.Title: “Standard City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DiggoryLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a large busy standard city hotel. We stayed on the 11th floor in a room overlooking the rear ( and sports stadium) which proved to be very comfortable. The room was air conditioner and a small fridge had been provided. We did not visit the restaurant but opted to use the White Spot family restaurant just a short walk up the road from the hotel. The only slight complaint being that you can hear people using the corridor, any conversations could be clearly heard in the bedroom. With regard to the general street area around the hotel we did not have any safety concerns, it was only a short walk to Chinatown. There are three different city tour bus companies operating from a bus stop directly outside the hotel front door. This provides a great opportunity to undertake a full circuit of the city in order to get your bearings prior to making your own way.

Reviews.Title: “Four Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: mach0r
Reviews.Content: At the end of a fly drive 16 day holiday from Calgary we decided to stay for extra nights in Vancouver. Sandman Hotel provided basic requirements to a standard you would expect. When booking in at first we were allocated an small room. This was a mistake by the booking in-person. After a debate (should we make a fuss etc) decided to complain and had the wind taken out of our sails when the (different) booking-in lady moved us to an excellent room with mountain views without any problems. The location was fine for access to downtown but hotel is on a main road so noise was a problem as was the music from the bar. Apart from that all was OK. Free WiFi. Pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Chain Hotel in Downtown area”
Reviews.Author: Bryan_Cash
Reviews.Content: A pretty standard room with an uninspiring view. Great location if you are going to the sports events or theatres. Good customer service from staff on front desk. Lift access to all floors. Good pool and on site restaurant (which is a bit pricey but saves you getting into Gastown).

Reviews.Title: “Subpar”
Reviews.Author: Fiona_Toronto
Reviews.Content: For the price that we paid for the hotel, it was ok. I would not pay full price for this hotel. The lobby is standard, modern. The elevator is such a bother, you must use your room key to access the elevator. The room size is great but that's all I can say about it. I had this one hair on the shower wall for 5 days...it was never washed/removed. There were stains on sheets (lower box) which I am hoping it was coffee stains. The noise from the street can easily be heard in your room and I was on a double digit floor. The pillows were so high that you are almost sitting up when you're laying down. The location is very convenient. Shoppers and restaurants around. I wouldn't go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: KLKOhio
Reviews.Content: After reading some poor reviews I was pleasantly surprised by the appearance of this downtown hotel. The lobby and public areas are very nice. The rooms are small, but fine for overnight. Our room in the north tower had a redecorated bathroom, but the sink area had no place to leave your toiletries and no place to hang towels. The onsite restaurant looked to be very expensive. We walked a few blocks and found some less expensive food. The hotel was a short taxi ride to the Port of Vancouver where we set sail on a cruise to Alaska.

Reviews.Title: “A low level of services”
Reviews.Author: Geeze1649
Reviews.Content: When checked in late in the evening there were 3 receptionists, they were busy looked at their computers and it took few minutes until one of them finally greeted us. No bell boy. Room was not equipped with a hair dyer, when asked for one, it took a day to deliver it to our room so we have to borrow from the room next door when the room was being cleaned. Used glasses was left uncleaned. The receptionist was unfriendly when answer questions.

Reviews.Title: “good bang for you buck!”
Reviews.Author: espanolosa
Reviews.Content: The newly renovated Sandman is good value for the reasonable price for a hotel downtown Vancouver. We were happy to see a nice bar fridge in the room to keep our water and juices, oh okay, and a few beer. beds were good, linens nice and not too noisy on the north side of the hotel. Great for walking to any show in the Queen E, Rogers arena or Orpheum.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ruby067
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SANDMAN for the first two days of our stay in Canada, and for a further day after a brief trip over to Vancouver Island. We found the reception staff to be very helpful and professional (especially Liberty), and we were allowed to leave our main luggage without charge in their store while we went over to Victoria, where we were limited to a small case on the float plane. We were upgraded to a suite on the 12th floor, with a large sitting/ eating room , a reasonable sized bedroom and a good bathroom. The furnishings were fine, except for the desk chairs, which looked rather scruffy (black leather). No problem accessing lifts.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Brendab72
Reviews.Content: It was easy to walk around the entire town from our hotel (especially since the weather is so nice). The room was so tiny though - similar to a London hotel. There is only one night table so I created another one by turning one of the many trash cans upside down (there is a big push for recycling). There is no place to hang towels in the tiny bathroom except for one silver ring behind the door, but it was only a mild inconvenience. The computers in the lobby were convenient and reasonably priced. We didn't have any trouble with noise from the nightclub from where our room was located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Central Located”
Reviews.Author: Ktravels12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for the first 4 night of out canada trip, It was a great hotel after reading all the reviews which some were misleading. We was on the 12 (top) Floor with a great view of the river and west Vancouver. There was a pool as well with a jacuzzi witch had a bad stench. The only bad point is the wireless internet dident work verry well on the 12 floor only by the door of the room ! apart from that verry good hotel would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: dizzyheights
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sandman Hotel on the 04th September. The location is slightly outside of the main down town area, but no more than a 15 minute walk to the key attractions. Staff at the front desk were helpful and friendly, but unfortunately for us this is where the good start ended. As reported in other reviews the elevators are small and busy and our room, although clean, was noisy facing on to West Georgia Street. Our air conditioning unit was also extremely noisy and to top it all off, we had a disturbed nights sleep from inconsiderate guests who were going between each other rooms all night. We reported our noise concerns to the hotel front desk, who did arrange for security to pay them a visit. However, this did not work and the noise continued up until around 4 am. We understand that the hotel was being used by an 18-30 group tour. However, management in the morning offered no more than an apology. At least in the UK at Travelodge you are offered a 'good nights sleep' guarantee. My recommendation would be to request a room that doesn't face onto West Georgia Street and on a floor with no 13-30 group tour parties.

Reviews.Title: “Did just what we wanted it to do”
Reviews.Author: HolidayHungry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sandman in early August at the top of a three week road-trip ending in Calgary. I had read the reviews before we set off and had a degree of trepidation. What can I say? Well - People and service - swift and good Lifts - well they worked and we only had a few queues but the stairs work well also Room - clean, tidy, comfortable and well ventilated (we had 8th floor) Food - perhaps not the cheapest in Moxie's (particularly breakfast), but tasty and delivered with excellent service. Evening waitresses worked hard for their tips but were also genuinely very pleasant Parking - you get used to paying for it after 8 different hotels Desk staff - accommodating and pleasant This hotel gave us a good base for a couple of days exploring and is near to Stanley Park which is a beautiful city 'lung'. In a city as small as Vancouver, part of the fun is trying out public transport systems, but we hired bikes on the front and walked a lot. I would recommend the Sandman for a few nights stop-over.

Reviews.Title: “The Stairmaster”
Reviews.Author: 1962Steve
Reviews.Content: Well all I can say is that I will not be staying at this Hotel ever again. I checked in with my wife, three young daughters and my mother-in-law on Sunday the 21st of August, 2011 and after we parked the van in the parkade we proceeded up the elevator to the lobby, this is where you have to switch to one of the other elevators that take you up to your floor. Well only one of the 2 were in service and a tour bus loaded with people had already checked in. There was a line up of people already waiting for the one operational elevator. As I was standing there with my family, finally next in line for the struggling elevator the bellman approached the elevator and announced that he had to get the luggage from the tour bus up to each of the floors. There were at least 20 full size suitcases in a row down the hallway that he alone began loading into the only elevator while my young daughters held their small pink suitcases at their sides. I could see that this fellow was having a tough time so I began helping him get the suitcases into the elevator. Soon after another man joined in as he was also becoming inpatient with the slow progress of the bellman. Once the elevator was full to the ceiling the bellman stepped in and the doors closed. We stood there now with a long line forming down the hallway wondering if we would ever see those doors open again. 15 minutes later it did come back and we squeezed as many of us in that elevator as we could. It proceeded up towards our 7th floor destination and passed right by it, even though we had repeatedly pushed our number. we were met on the 9th floor by a very frustrated woman that insisted on wedging herself in with us for she had also been waiting for 15 minutes. She had been staying in the Hotel for 2 nights and finally got so upset with the one intermittent elevator that she demanded to be moved to another room in the other tower that had a different elevator system. We did make it to our room and stayed 2 nights. What time we didn't spend waiting for the elevator we were walking up and down the 7 flights of stairs along with many other frustrated guests. We booked the room 2 weeks in advance and we had requested a refrigerator, well when we got to our room, no fridge. Manager said no more fridges. They only had 2 bath towels in each room, we had 3 people in each of our rooms. Had to call desk. Next day after maid service, 2 towels again. By far my worst Hotel experience...Shame on you Sandman!!

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights and on arrival the impression we got from the lobby was that it would be a nice hotel. The staff on the front desk were helpful and friendly. We were able to check in at 12:30pm and the hotel parking was easy to use but expensive at $20 per day. Initially the room seemed ok however, the furniture was shabby with handles hanging off the drawers, which we fixed. The room had air conditioning but it could only be set between 20 - 24C. The beds were comfy and the toiletries were nice, however the bathroom was extremely poor. The bath filled with water above your ankles after a 5mins shower, meaning you were stood in 4inches of scum from the plug hole. The extraction was poor so the bathroom had mould on the walls and ceiling. We were in a room on the third floor which meant we were above the bar, this meant the room the was noisy until midnight. I would ask for a room on a higher floor. There is a Moxies restaurant in the hotel which is good for food. But this cant be charged to your room, you have to pay the server. The hotel is in a good location for shopping and to visit the tourist area of Gastown. It seems like the money is spent on a flashy lobby and fitness suite and not the rooms, which is a real shame.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not the best location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Caspartje
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights after arriving in Canada for a 2-week trip. Hotel room is very nice and clean, large with everything you need (ironer etc.). However, free WiFi is very very slow (the only thing you can do is check your email). Location is okay, but a bit away from the downtown action. A lot of tramps on the street at night, but they do not bother you. Breakfast is served in the attached restaurant (okay, nothing special).

Reviews.Title: “A typical Sandman hotel - average!”
Reviews.Author: KeepSmilingUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite well located, within ten minutes' walk of the main downtown area. Check-in was efficient, although not friendly - but, maybe that's because it's in a big city. It claims to have been refurbished recently and I guess the plain and simple decor confirms this, but why didn't they do something about the awful lighting in the bedrooms while they were at it? One light beside the bed and one in the hallway may be romantic but is otherwise useless. There wasn't even a lamp on the desk unit. Our room, with two Queen-sized beds, and bathroom with bath, shower, wc and handbasin were both clean and tidy. Toiletries were Sandman's standard Pharmacopia soap, shampoo and conditioner. The air-conditioning was efficient and reasonably quiet. A coffee percolator with ample supplies was provided. WiFi in the room was free of charge. The lifts were very slow - basically, there are insufficient lifts for the number of floors and rooms. It would be difficult to improve this, so my advice would be to choose your stay to coincide with a time of low occupancy! Because of its location, rooms at the front of the hotel tend to suffer from traffic noise. We also had a problem with noise in the corridor outside our room because of its proximity to the vending and ice machines.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a business hotel - Internet is useless”
Reviews.Author: Greg S
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at the Vancouver Sandman, during our organization's annual week long conference. 40-50 people, 4-7 nights stays. The wifi access is simply unusable in most of the guest suites. I've had four staff members tell me they would find me a 'booster' of some kind to improve the situation, not one of them did, worse, not one of them got back to me as to why. I finally reached out to our Events Sales Manager, Evan Slade with the problem who arranged for me to switch rooms to one nearer a router... Unfortunately, the new room was absolutely no better - THE INTERNET IS ESSENTIALLY USELESS. I wrote a polite, but firm letter to Mr. Slade describing the ongoing problem and again, no reply from him or anyone else. Simply unacceptable We booked two large suites for our office & hospitality suite - somehow, they ripped them up for renovation the day we arrived. Oh yeah - the 'business center' actually consists of two old PC's in the lobby, available for your use at $3 per 15 minutes.... Take your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend as a cheap Vancouver option”
Reviews.Author: lions1
Reviews.Content: Quite a large room with 2 double beds, staff helpful, meals good and well priced handy to Rogers Arena, some lift issues

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Tinselcat
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous about this hotel after reading reviews but were pleasantly surprised on all counts. The area seemed fine and was within shortish walking distance of Gastown, Chinatown and so on. The Big Bus tour company operates it's hop on hop off service from outside the main door. $ 38 for a two day pass was worth it as you can access some places on this that you can't on SkyTrain. The room was very clean, very nicely decorated, well equipped and VERY quiet all the time we were there (over a weekend!). The bed was huge and by far the most comfortable we've encountered in Canada. We never queued for the lift- it always came immediately. We were able to check-in early and the staff we met were professional, efficient and courteous. Vancouver is a fabulous place and this was a great hotel to stay in while we explored. There are so many restaurants, cafes and shops about that you can easily find places within your budget!

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel - No amenities”
Reviews.Author: timbosul
Reviews.Content: We visited Vancouver last summer and our travel agent put us in this hotel. Our room was very dark, the hotel is older. We opened the window which looked out onto a rooftop and a brick wall - which didn't help with the light. Got up for breakfast the next day and there was no coffee downstairs so I had to go out and get coffee. Spent $70 on breakfast for 4. I also remember the staff at the front desk was not the friendliest. We wound up moving around the corner to another hotel. The room was less expensive, breakfast was included and the room had a window that looked out over the city.

Reviews.Title: “really excellent”
Reviews.Author: tufnellparkandy
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was excellent- first class service from Reception and really helpful staff who went out of their way to help. Early check in wasn't a problem which was great after a 10 hour flight. My room had recently been refurbished and was to a really high quality. Really good night's sleep. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again the next time I'm fortunate enough to be in Vancouver. First class!

Reviews.Title: “Not too sure if we would go back...”
Reviews.Author: Canshy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was rather nice- Very nice lobby (there was a female crackhead outside who followed us to the front doors asking for money but the hotel obviously did something about it as she wasn't there ten minutes later when we headed out to site see)/ The check in agent was very pleasant, told us about local events going on etc. Hotel room was all right...Were given a government rate which is always appreciated as I travel from time to time for business purposes. I was concerned about bed bugs as I had read a prior review stating this was a problem but our room was fine. No buggies and the room appeared clean. The bathroom had no windows and it had one small vent blowing air into the bathroom (not sucking it out as it should) but there was an air conditioner in the room itself so this wasn't too bad. Lots of hot water, shower had good water pressure, etc. Towels and tub were a bit small but I'm a big girl. ;) We left the room at lunch (the chambermaids were sort of hovering outside the door when we left) and when we returned just before 5 our room had not been tended too. This wouldn't have bothered us except that we needed clean towels to shower off all the sweat from sight seeing. Hubby called the front desk and they had some clean towels brought up to us right away by a very friendly lady (and the room was done before we returned later in the evening) I think the only real complaint we had about this hotel was that during our second night there, we were sleeping (as most people are around 3 in the morning) and we awoke to the sound of our hotel room door being opened by some drunk guests who were confused. Apparently they were staying in one of the other rooms but it was disturbing that their KEY CARD unlocked OUR hotel door!!! If we hadn't had the latch over the door or if we hadn't been in the room, they would have wandered right inside. Kind of a security issue... We mentioned this to the front desk agent when we checked out and she said she'd never heard of this happening so maybe it was a one time deal but safety (especially in downtown) is pretty important to me so I'll be unsure about staying there in the future. Neither hubby or I slept very much the rest of that night. Aside from that, it was a very nice hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent on 11th floor. Noisy close to nightclub on 2nd floor.”
Reviews.Author: bobandpat39
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to arrive late afternoon when the nightclub on the 2nd floor were geering up which meant when we entered our 3rd floor room because of the noise we walked straight out and were given a room on the 11th floor which was excellent. Those on our tour staying on the lower floors, experienced sleepless nights because of the noise from the nightclub which continued until the early hours of the morning. The hotel is a short walk from the railway station where frequent trains go to the airport or into downtown. It is also easy to take the train to the next station and walk to Grand Central station to catch the Amtrak train to Seattle or elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel is old and has only 2 lifts , will not return”
Reviews.Author: pmwilly
Reviews.Content: very old no room service , baggage to rooms took over a one and half hours,got kicked of the lift three times so it could be used by staff would not recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Vancouver on Holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bob7580414
Reviews.Content: Arrived late evening it took a bit of finding directions not very clear, it is near to the ice hockey stadium. The staff are friendly but not really chatty, the room was comfortable the bed was a bit firm for us. Moxies restaurant is very nice but pricey. But so is Vancouver in general. Good central location.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad Area and Rather Sad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FunkMaster007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on two separate occasions during our trip to Vancouver, first when we arrived in Vancouver and then again when we returned to Vancouver after a 2 week long road trip. Our first stay, we were put in a room that seemed decent enough, but the bed was rather uncomfortable and they don't actually use a duvet cover, but rather a sheet and skimpy little blanket as the bed linen. The pillows were of poor quality too, like they had been flattened and no matter what you did, they just stayed flat. We first stayed in the North Tower, there is no room service provided in this block. The wireless internet is pretty useless, free as it may be, it never keeps a connection for longer than 10 minutes and is quite slow in comparison with other hotels we stayed at, with the same size. We rented a car for the trip and the hotel charged us $15 excluding TAX to park our car. They say it's safe, but you can get to the parking garage through the hotel, without needed to use a access card or anything, not very secure in my mind. The area in which this hotel is, is pretty much on the border for the worst part of Downtown Vancouver, (Hastings) which suffers from a great deal of people on drugs, alcohol abuse and homelessness. On one occasion, in the morning, we were sat in the hotel lobby awaiting a representative from our tour company and we met a girl in the lobby, who clearly was a drug addict, seeking refuge (a warm place to relax) and the hotel staff did nothing about it. I am not saying that they should have called the cops, but having her there, just showed that they didn't care who used the hotel lobby as a half way house. It was an uncomfortable feeling and we left quite promptly. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy hotel, bar booming out music directly under rooms.”
Reviews.Author: marlo876
Reviews.Content: A tired looking hotel, very noisy due to internal bar booming out music. Although we paid in advance for porterage service our luggage took over two hours to arrive from the lobby, we gave up on departure and struggled on alone. Would not advise as suitable for the more mature couple or anyone expecting to have a peaceful rest.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Edwin_Lin
Reviews.Content: Very clean room indeed and the staff were very helpful. It's location on Cambie & Georgia make it ideal for walking around downtown, Granville and Vancouver City transit stations just ten minutes walk. The Canada line is ideal if you fly in as we did, the rapid transit in Vancouver is very efficient and good value for money. This hotel is ideal for business or pleasure and we recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and adequate”
Reviews.Author: darryl57
Reviews.Content: Very clean room and hotel in general. Reception OK but a bit slow. Hotel does not appear to have any character. In a reasonable position. Expensive but then this is Vancouver. Would stay again if I had to visit Vancouver again. Nothing really to complain about and nothing to rave about.

Reviews.Title: “It was adequate”
Reviews.Author: davidcornwall
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and staff friendly, however there was nowhere to hang towels in the bathroom and we had to ask for shampoo as the one in the room was half empty. Also there was only on bedside cabinet and lamp which was inconvenient if one person wanted to read at night. We requested another cabinet and lamp but didn't get it. The lifts broke down and as we were on the 11th floor and I have trouble with my back and legs I couldn't get to my room till they were fixed which fortunately wasn't too long.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: musicmanD8
Reviews.Content: I am not picky about hotels. So the fact that this one is horrible really says something. The elevators are incredibly slow if they work at all. The "wireless internet" is non- existent. It takes up to 10 minutes for an email to load. The rooms are extremely small and not worth the price. At this point, a hostel would be better. As for business, I am not able to do any work here due to the poor internet. Best of luck if you want to risk this horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Suellanelli
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the previous reviews on this hotel I was dreading staying there but I was in for a happy suprise. The rooms were small but with a queen sized bed, well laid out and very clean. We were 2 couples and our friends also had a very good room. Our room was near the lifts but we could not hear a lot of noise. The hotel has a good pool which we well used during our stay. The Sandman is well situated for visiting the sights, of whichthere are many. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Previous reviews had complained about them but we found them to be very helpful. We did eat one night in the hotel and found it very good although you are spoilt for choice in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value with Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: lagos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sandman for an overnight stay in a family room. When arriving at checkin the queue was enormous and we had to wait for what was easily 20-30 minutes. Upon check in we realised that we had left all of our paperwork/passports in the cab we had arrived at the hotel in which had since departed. Clearly in a mad panic, the receptionist took control of the situation ringing round a number of different cab companies. Fortunately, after around 3-4 attempts, she located the cab company, the driver and the paperwork and passports - result! Taking control of the situation and resolving what was a very distressing time caused us all to relax and start enjoying our trip. The cab driver arrived within the hour and everything was as it should be - it's not often that people are this honest these days! We went to our room (which was huge!) and clean and headed into Vancouver for the night. The following morning, we had breakfast and what a fantastic breakfast it was too! Again, the staff were exceptional, the breakfast arrived within what was probably less than 5 minutes and the food tasted just great! We decided to opt for a kids breakfast each, expecting that the 'adult' breakfast's would be too big. The kids breakfasts were more than adequate for what we wanted and kept us full until lunch time. A little on the expensive side, but still worth it. On the night, we had dinner at the Sports Bar in the hotel - not quite as nice as breakfast. Meal was very nice but again, a little on the expensive side. The 'mini' mousse is really yummy so definately recommend that! We were put off a little by the atire that the staff were wearing but if your a single bunch of lads you will love that part! Overall, the hotel is comfortable and clean and I would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Return stay.”
Reviews.Author: ayrbrain
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights before our cruise and 2 on our return. An ok hotel. After 2 phone calls to reception, secruity sorted out the very very noisy guests in the next room, it was unbelievable the noise they made having a party. The following weekend was the Canuck game in town, it was amazing to watch from the window the crowds in the streets, we really thought we were in for another rowdy weekend in the hotel but far from it as it was very quiet thankfully. We arrived at 10am from our cruise and were pleased to be told our room was ready.

Reviews.Title: “An aging property in need of a comprehensive renovation.”
Reviews.Author: RetireeBob
Reviews.Content: An aging property in need of a comprehensive renovation. We stayed at this hotel on three separate occassions over three weeks as part of a tour. For some reason, the rooms at the front of the hotel don't have a mini refridgerator, while those at the back do. We were on the 4th floor and could not sleep due to the noise from the Nightclub below and the street noise. The windows are double glazed to reduce nosie but we needed to open them to get some fresh air as the rooms had a lingering smell. Bathroom or smokers in a non smoking room? On the 2nd visit they gave us the same room as before, so we asked for a different one and got a much better room on the 6th floor with a fridge and a better bathroom layout. A good sleep was had. On the third visit, again the 4th floor. This time the room hadn't been cleaned properly, (partially consumed drink left on bedside chest and a used diabetes test strip on the floor) the bedside lamp didn't work (broken switch), one of the beds was off its base and the security lock had been removed from the door, wallpaper peeling. The final nail was the drink and ice machines outside the door which sound like they need new motors. After complaining we were given a perfectly good room at the back on the 11th floor. Only negative here was a non working coffee perculator. The elevators are small and very slow, you can wait for 5 mins on the 11th floor and much longer at busy times like the morning.

Reviews.Title: “who desighed this place?”
Reviews.Author: barryjc
Reviews.Content: We checked in this hotel for 4 days prior to taking a cruise to Alaska. To get to our room on the 7 th floor we had to queue for the lift. About 6 out of 10 times we had to queue because there are not enough lifts to serve the rooms. The bedrooms are nice and its clean, however its when you enter the bathroom it becomes a problem. There are no towel rails. Nowhere to hang a towel. Not a coathook, nothing.The new towels are left rolled up on a shelf under the hand basin. When you've used them you leave the hand towels on the basin and the bath towels on the bath. In the main room there is also not a coat hook so your coats are thrown over the armchair. This was not just our room. My family stayed in another room that was the same. On our return a week later we had to stay 1 night and they put us in "refurbished" rooms. Still no towel rails for the bath towels but a small towel ring for 1 hand towel next to the basin. But the special thing about this room was, NO WARDROBE, and still no coathooks. But we did have a nice big refridgerator that was empty. There are no dining rooms here but there is a branch of a restaurant chain called "moxies" joined to the hotel. The menu will suite Canadians and Americans but not Brits as it has all the fry up and the pancakes and fruit on the same plate. There are some nice diners within 5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Way above expectations!”
Reviews.Author: marsh_aus
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Vancouver was booked through a travel agent so we had no input as to where we would get to stay. I checked out all the reviews on here and was a bit underwhelmed. But, to the future and when we arrived I was amazed. The lobby is very clean and inviting. We were so busy staff were no issue. Now, to the room, and wow. We had a double queen room in the north tower and it was huge. 2 Queen beds with heaps and heaps of space. A flat screen TV is also good with heaps of channels. Bathroom is very nice with good quality toiletries (the shampoo was great) Beds are very comfy and we slept amazingly well. Noise was no issue EVER. The Shark Bar downstairs is very cool with good cheap food and good drinks. The staff there were awesome to tourists like us. My friend tells me the pool and spa was great and also a pretty decent gym/workout area. The only thing lacking in the room was fresh milk so we could make hot drinks but can definitely overlook that for the quality of the rest of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: WorldWanderer99
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the downtown Vancouver Sandman Hotel prior to going on a cruise to Alaska. I wasn't sure what to expect after reading the reviews but it was okay. It had a nice lobby, was in a good location for walking to shops and restaurants, and was in a decent neighborhood. The hotel could definitely use more elevators. There were two for each tower. I believe we stayed in the North Tower and there were couches outside the elevators due to the long wait when it became busy with people checking in/out. In addition, one of the elevators broke and it took forever to wait for one. Luckily they do have stairs. The hotel had a sports bar (Shark Bar) that served food. However they were charging $6.00 a person the night we stayed since the Canucks were playing in a hockey game that night. It wasn't a home game but rather for people who wanted to watch the game on television. There is also a restaurant, Moxies's Grill, that I will give a separate review on. The hotel also had a pool and whirlpool which neither of us used. The people checking us in and out were not the friendliest. They did call us a taxi and I was impressed with the speed of their arrival to take us to Canada Place. The hotel did have wireless internet. However, It was constantly busy and I was unable to acquire a network signal at any time. There are two computers available in the lobby which you can pay to use the internet. At the time I got desperate enough to pay to use their computer and internet there were no chairs to sit down on since other customers waiting for a bus or taxi were sitting in them. Our room was not as bad as I thought it would be. It was roomy enough. It had a flat screen television, separate bath/toilet from the vanity area, and overall it was clean. The room did not have a refrigerator or microwave. It was a basic room with no special frills. Overall, it was an okay place to stay. We didn't experience bed bugs, loud noise, or a tiny room where you couldn't walk around. The rooms were not what I would consider luxury nor was it a dump! We got what I considered a decent price on the room considering it's in a major city. I honestly have no complaints about it except for not being able to get on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: scottcrow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are currently staying in the hotel and Love it! I was very concerned after reading the many articles about the Sandman but was very impressed how the General Mgr Michael Lopez steped up to the plate to make corrections and answer customer concerns. The good and bad to this story is the the old tower does show signs of wear. But the new tower is outstanding. All of these newly remodeled room have a European feel and is just as nice as the 5 Star Hyatt room we stayed in last night in Orlando, Florida. They are a bit smaller then the rooms we have stayed at but we still have plenty of room and love the decor. Every thing is clean and so signs of the Bed Bugs we have read about, Our room was not ready when we arrived early but within 15 min we were sent up. Plus they now have FREE wireless internet a added value. If you stay here ask for the new tower when you make your reservation. Its a great price for a great room and within walking distance of everything. Scott &Lydia Crow Titusville, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: TekyJeff
Reviews.Content: Our room (queen-sized bed) was about 12x12 with a 6x12 bathroom. No closet and no place to hang things up. OK for 1, but crowded for 2. The lobby was undergoing renovations. Otherwise, the location, service, and room were all very good.

Reviews.Title: “If I knew electricity was extra I would have gladly paid for it.”
Reviews.Author: Meathawk
Reviews.Content: Yes my rate was cheap, but having the power and phone shut off in the entire North Tower, with no notice to the guests, made showering in complete darkness a hotel experience I will never forget. I went to the front desk to complain, and they didn't seem to care, and said it must have been the construction crews who were working on the hotel. Gee do you think? I inquired and complained in the afternoon to the duty manager, and he didn't know anything about it, and didn't offer one of nights comped or any other resolution. I had to shave by the light of my laptop. If you want a shower with lighting just go down to the leaking parkade below the hotel. Also important; Unless you like to stay in a frat house, with a kegger party on every floor, don't stay here on a game night when the Canucks or BC Lions are playing. The noise up and down the halls is brutal, and is not attended to by the front desk or security very quickly, and they are brutally slow at answering the phone. The restaurant/nightclub attached to the hotel, is a dump. The rooms are small and you may feel like you are staying in a shoebox, the hotel security is a joke, and although It has keycard locks in the elevators, they are just there for show and aren't needed. You have to pay to use the Gym, The movie selection is limited and outdated. And the heater/ air conditioner works, but judging by the wierd funk that comes from them, I doubt they change the air filters very often Cheap room yes, but the "decorum" you get from the place, and the not stop rowdiness, makes this Hotel more like Animal House with a front desk. And don't bother with Room Service, there are no menus in the rooms, and the room service staff don't have time to tell you whats on the menu. Next Time I'm spending the dough, and getting a place somewhere else with electricity.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for hockey fans”
Reviews.Author: Victoriakm
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here simply because of it's location...a 2minute walk to Rogers Arena. There is a Moxie's Bar downstairs that is usually packed before a game. Staff were very nice, and the parking is gated. The fire alarm went off twice but seemed to be an accident. Check in and out were quick and efficient. We would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Vancouver, especially if you are going to a Canucks game, or even a BC Lions game.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations look awesome”
Reviews.Author: needaholiday15
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sandman Downtown by Rogers Arena this past Friday, very enjoyable trip. My wife and I went to Danko Jones concert for her birthday at the Commodore, which was ok, but you can read about that in another review. I enjoyed the location of the hotel in comparision to everything that you can see and find near it. Only a short distance from the venue and restaurants. Our room was a renovated room that came with a King bed and couch. The room was very clean and welcoming. The lobby was very beautiful with amazing art work and a brand new desk that was being installed. My wife and I had a enjoyable stay, even for a 1 night quick trip. Would definently stay here again if in town for another event or getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, and reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: blt100
Reviews.Content: The location was good - only a short walk from Stadium/China town skytrain stop. It was a short walk up to Granville St. The ice machine outside of our room, was very noisy at times. We contacted reception about this and they said someone would check it out, but it didn't seem to make any difference. It was very busy when there was a home ice hockey game.

Reviews.Title: “Suited us fine, so we stayed there twice!”
Reviews.Author: Varietal
Reviews.Content: Our Canadian Rockies tour started and finished at the Sandman, so we didn't have a choice as both the first and last nights of the tour were included. We booked in a night early to de-jetlag ourselves. We were disappointed in the size of the room as we unpacked and then we discovered there was no fridge! (Haven't seen a hotel room without a fridge in many years!) Reception said they'd send one up and it would cost us $10/nite, but when I said there's not even enough room for our bags, much less a fridge, they offered to move us to a larger room that had a fridge. EXCELLENT!! Twice the size AND it had a microwave, too - all at NO extra charge. We were happily impressed. The staff continued to impress us with some free internet vouchers, an offer to store an extra bag for us while we were on tour and some excellent advice on local stuff. I'll ditto other reviews of the Sandman Downtown in relation to the pool - immaculate and pleasantly warm with the spa actually HOT :-). The location may leave a bit to be desired for some, but with the rail only a block away and the busses at our doorstep and everything we needed within walking distance...we were happy to extend our stay a couple more nites after our tour.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: AmandaDH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and when we returned home we had brought bed bugs home with us. I had 67 bites alone on one arm, and it took 6 months to get rid of them. We informed the manager of the hotel about the bugs and he had an exterminator come in and found adult bed bugs in the room we stayed in. We were not reimbersed even a cent for our stay. I would never stay at this hotel again. If you do stay there be VERY careful with your clothes and suitcases cause the bugs are difinately there.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job.”
Reviews.Author: rdg444
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Sandman on West Georgia. It was perfectly located for Rogers Arena where we watched the Canucks kick the Wild's butt. It's also well located for the "touristy" parts of Vancouver. The hotel is slightly above average but clean & comfortable & fitted our purpose.It was well appointed with everything you'd expect to have. The front desk staff were corteous & helpful. Friday was noisy in the city after the hockey game but we were on the 10th floor of the North Tower so we got a bit of noise carrying up to us. The Shark Bar was popular after the game but OK on the other nights. Moxie's on the 2nd floor has great food if a little pricey & our waiter Jon was good fun & made the meal even more enjoyable. The music was a little too loud. We normally try different hotels on different visits so we may not stay there again but if it came down to it we wouldn't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: MelMcHenry
Reviews.Content: We were relocated to the Sandman Hotel after the Ramada oversold. The hotel itself is much nicer than the Ramada on Granville. The location is also better in that it's less seedy. It's within walking distance of both Gas Town and Robson street. There is a decent bar in the hotel - Shark's - which had a crazy Monday Night Football party going on when we were there. I didn't know Canadians care so much about football! We did not eat in the restaurant or use any of the other services (hot tub, etc.). My only real complaint about this hotel is that the elevator is fruratingly, annoyingly, painfully slow. You will want to minimize trips up and down because of it. In all, it was a sufficient hotel but nothing special to rave about.

Reviews.Title: “Stopover”
Reviews.Author: johnsuperstar9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to all sights etc, lots of restaurants close by. The staff were great and the rooms adequate. The lifts worked but always busy. Our room overlooked a building site but not really a problem.

Reviews.Title: “An old hotel, poorly modernised with tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: browserwowser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights to visit Vancouver. The location was OK near ot the main downtown areas of Vancouver. The room was at the back of the hotel and had been refurbished. The lifts were tiny and scruffy with buttons broken. There never seemed to be enough staff on reception. The room was tiny with a large air-conditioner up the corner. There was no bedside light or bedside cabinet for my wife and the bathroom fan did not operate. When I reported these things I was told not to expect them to get fixed and they didn't. The linen and towels were fine and clean. At nearly a hundred pounds a night booked as a special offer through Canadian Affairs I considered this hotel poor value for the money and will not use it again. For the parking i expected to pay an extra 15 dollars a night - in fact it was an extra 20 dollars a night

Reviews.Title: “Happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoRo_in_Perth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sandman Hotel for three nights in July and August before I did a tour around the Canadian Rockies. I was very happy with our room. It was quite large, with plenty of room for suitcases and bags. The bathroom was decent too, split into a bath/shower and toilet, and then a separate area with a basin, so two people could get ready at the same time, which was handy. The lift was painfully slow at times...I expected such a big hotel to have better lifts. The walls are quite thin...I woke up one night at midnight as the person in the room next door had their TV blaring and I could hear everything. But apart from that night, I generally slept well. The location was good, we walked to Robson Street and nearby areas, and hired bikes and rode to Stanley Park, which I would highly recommend, the park is stunning. The hotel is close to the subway, which was handy going to and from the airport. We also used the subway to get to the waterfront, from there we took the seabus and bus to get to Lynn Canyon park, which I also would recommend. Vancouver is a beautiful city and I was happy with my stay at the Sandman. Clean and quiet rooms, comfy beds and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: kinx81
Reviews.Content: For downtown Vancouver, and not having to spend and arm and a leg, this is a good choice. Parking is $15 plus tax, but I felt it was pretty secure. You can walk to Robson Street and Yaletown, and the Rogers Arena (formerly GM Place) is right across the street. Beds were very comfortable, large flat screen tv, free wireless internet, and check-in and out was very smooth, with little wait. I liked that we had a corner room, as they are usually a bit bigger than the other standard rooms. Also, the bathroom has a sink that is separated by a door from the toilet and tub/shower. I like this design, makes it easier for two people to be getting ready at the same time. The Moxie's restaurant is connected to this hotel, and offers a good breakfast. I believe it is open at 6am which is great if you need to get an early start. Have no clue what the below reviewer is talking about - our waiter did NOT automatically add tip to the bill. This is NOT typical practice in Canada, unless maybe if you have a group of 10 or more (or whatever that particular restaurant's policy is on that).

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: SwissJohn
Reviews.Content: Started badly with porter leaving trolley next to our bags only, but not helping with the large amount of luggage despite having three children including a baby with us. Trolley not collected from room despite us requesting this to be removed. Childrens' bed not made up, and when baby started crawling, we quickly realised how dirty the floor/carpet was in the room; it took ages to get the dirt off her hands and feet. Area is poor, not far from shopping area, but if go wrong way out of hotel, i.e. towards China town, you quickly end up in an area frequented by drug addicts. Hotel restaurant Moxies does however offer a fantastic Sticky Toffee Pudding with ice cream. Breakfasts not recommended. Quite aggressive tipping policy, i.e. waiter ringing 15% on the bill as if this was obligatory, irrespective of quality of service, it is not.

Reviews.Title: “A great base hotel with a lovely resturant called Moxies”
Reviews.Author: cheekie77
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop in Canada and we were not disappointed. We were quick to be seen on arrival and were straight off up to our rooms - brilliantly big beds and nice sized room with sofa and a fridge. View not so great but we were here to see Canada not our hotel room. We actually went to the Moxie Grill most days and nights for food as it was really really good food. The breakfast were faultless and were actually the best we had all holiday - beware they are huge....enough to set you up for the day. The Sandman is actually a fair walk to the main city unless you are fit - only about 10 mins but not the nicest of walks. However there are plentyof bus's not that we ever used one. There is also the big red bus tour stop right outside the hotel which is an extra cost but well worth it as it takes you all round vancouver and you can get on and off where you want along the trip to see the sights - you must visit Stanley park lovely to walk around or go on a horse drawn carriage trip - we were lucky and saw a family of racoons right in front of us. You need I would say a good 3 days+ in Vancouver and this is an indeal place to stop.

Reviews.Title: “OK place, central, easy”
Reviews.Author: twinsonic
Reviews.Content: The Sandman is an old hotel that is currently refurbished. We stayed in a nice room with a King size bed and microwave. Since we only stayed the nights there, I have no complaints, except for the night the hotel experienced a fire drill!!!!!!! Five past twelve the bells started to ring.. just nicely drifting off..got all our valuables and ran down the steps... outside across the road. Fire brigade arrived, lots of people standing around. In all that time NO ONE bothered to update guests what is happening, where to go, what to do. No manager was able to communicate.. Once the fire brigade drove off, most assumed it is safe to go back. But the lifts did not work.. No conversation here either.. No apologies, nothing... I think this is very bad and shows lack of training..Thank God it was false alarm, but still.. lots of improvement necessary!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth its price. Noisy from nightclub and rooms are old & filthy”
Reviews.Author: na13bouk
Reviews.Content: If I had any alternative option, I would not stay at the Sandman's again. All the three of us had to change rooms after the first night due to noise and filthyness. One of my colleagues left one night earlier then scheduled with her decolletée full of bed bugs bites. I also felt itchy for several days but did not react to them so badly - lucky me. The second room was in a higher floor, more quiet and cleaner, so if you have to stay there ask for a room in the 10th or 11th floor or in the second tower building.

Reviews.Title: “disorganised chaos”
Reviews.Author: oldshep77
Reviews.Content: When we arrived reception was very busy and had to wait about 20 mins to be attended to. Our first allocated room was already occupied so had to request another room only to find yet again that this room was also occupied. The manager couldn't explain the error and put us in a South Tower suite, which was only one room with microwave and fridge. The hotel generally looks very tired and the lifts seem to have a mind of their own. Be prepared to queue for breakfast between 7 and 8am.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of Choice -- Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: mikeb1985
Reviews.Content: I am required to go to Vancouver multiple times per year with work and the Sandman is my preferred accommodation. Its central location, friendly staff and well appointed rooms make it worthy of my continued loyalty. The Sandman doesn't make any claims of grandeur nor does it advertise itself as anything other than a 3-star hotel in a central location. Never any problems.

Reviews.Title: “satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: daisymay74
Reviews.Content: found this hotel to be very central to everything and within walking distance of most tourist attractions. staff were very helpful regarding any queries i had and the rooms were spacious and clean. could do with some extra lifts in lobby as when have a group of 48 checking in alot of people to queue for a lift.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: ellimac0711
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is nice and Moxie's is attached so you can have dinner or drinks during your stay while being close to your room. The front desk was very helpful and quick during our check in/out. The room that we stayed in was small it was definitely just a bedroom. A queen bed with a small washroom, a couch and a miniature balcony. I think that the hotel rooms could use a good renovation. But the location is convenient and only walking distance from shopping areas is downtown Vancouver such as Robson Street. I've stayed at the same hotel twice now and would return again in the future. Just don't expect anything fancy and most of the time we were running out and about during our stay. It was good place to sleep at the end of the night.

Reviews.Title: “You can find a better hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: 1345309Cass
Reviews.Content: We stayed because it was soooo close to GM place. And that would be the only plus of this hotel. Location is great but there are other hotels just as close that give you bigger beds, nicer rooms and more comfortable beds. Had to pay extra to park, and all the ice machines (only have 4 I believe for the entire hotel) were empty by 7PM. Bad view of a brick wall...do yourself a favour and find another hotel there is plenty!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disorganized Place to Stay for a Night. . .”
Reviews.Author: marathonmomma
