Reviews.Content: I was traveling on business and looking for a reasonably priced Vancouver hotel convenient to downtown, so decided to stay here for one night. My husband booked the reservation online on the Sandman Hotels website, however when I went to check in that evening, they had no record of the reservation, even though I had a confirmation number. They did manage to find a room for me and when I went to the elevator bank to get up to my room there was a sign on the elevator door saying "out of order." I asked a staff person if they knew where I could find the stairs, she looked very confused and said she would try and ask someone. Later, after waiting for some time for the staff person to come back and tell me where the stairs were, I saw someone get out of the elevator which was supposedly out of order. It became obvious that someone had just forgotten to remove the "out of order" sign. Although they say there is wifi available I could not get a wireless connection in the room, so went down to the lobby and asked where they had a connection. The staff person said sometimes it took awhile and he would try to get some sort of connection for me. As there was no one around and he did not look busy, I asked if he would call me in my room when this happened, however he never called to let me know. On the positive side, the location of this hotel was convenient to where I needed to be the next morning. The room was extremely small, however the price was reasonable. I most likely would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I was expecting (& preconfirmed) that...”
Reviews.Author: acanuck4ever
Reviews.Content: I was expecting (& preconfirmed) that this was a "suite" but it was not. Had a king bed and small pull-out sofa bed crammed into one small room. I could have paid equal price for a far superior hotel & room down the street. Also, asked for bus directions to ferry and turned out they completely gave me wrong info.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Yonkers_au
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time I've stayed at the Sandman. The rooms have been renovated since my last stay and they look great. There was a minor issue with my booking, but that was taken care of immediately. I had asked for a very late checkout and there were no issues with this. The location is great. The food is great and it's pretty much in the center of restaurants, shopping, etc. GM Place and BC Stadium are less than 5 mins walk. The only downside was that I was near the ice machine which did interrupt my sleep at times. Other than that, a fantastic stay as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Made My Night!”
Reviews.Author: VancouverD72
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sandman Downtown, and it was fabulous. The employees were very nice and had all the answers to our questions, the service was fast and effective. Our room was spotless, and had fantastic views of False Creek and the North Shore mountains. The hotel is in a prime location, footsteps from BC and GM Place, and a short 5 min walk to the Vancouver nightlife and Yaletown. Sandman would be my first choice the next time I stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: MJSLovelyn
Reviews.Content: Stay was good, food was ok - location was good - ambience was acceptable. Customer service should be improved

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Employees, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: KelownaReview
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sandman on Georgia for one night in January. Upon arrival the check in clerk was very friendly and talkative. I requested to be away from any elevators and ice machines since I was travelling with a light sleeper, the room they had me in was located close to the elevator but after making the comment they immediately moved me as far away as possible. They ended up placing us on the top floor, as far down the hallway as possible overlooking the city, so it was a beautiful room. The decoration was very modern and the renovations done were quite beautiful. We went into Moxie's located right on site, it was practically dead in there so the service was fantastic and the food came amazingly quickly. The decorations in the restaurant were also very nice, we loved the vases they had all around. At check out the process was very quick and efficient and once again the lady that checked us out was very friendly and seemed happy to be there. Overall we had a great experience and would most certainly recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best place”
Reviews.Author: jeomai
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that we have stayed in the Sandman Hotel. The location within a 5 minute walk takes you to GM Place and BC place. The Granville strip is only ten minutes away. We were in a spacious room with two queen beds room that exceeded our expiations. Obviously newly renovated the hallways and lobbies have a warm feeling to them (other than the slow elevator). The rooms were clean and the staff welcoming and courteous. The hotel also includes Moxie’s Grill and the Shark club (a great place for after any game). We would highly recommend this hotel to any one looking for an affordable room in the Downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “When you do complain, they deny the problem is occuring...”
Reviews.Author: FL2NYCGGuy
Reviews.Content: So far, when people have complained of windows left open and chemical odors, they're told that there are no chemical odors, the windows weren't left open, and that no one else has complained... clearly not true. Then when really confronted, they default to saying that "Someone was sick in that hallway, and it had to be cleaned." Really? How many floors has this happened on? Barfing-in-Hallways seems to be epidemic! It even sounds rehearsed. And by the way, it was the hotel staff who first used the word "quarantine." That shouldn't worry you at all. Nope, not one bit. To end on a positive note, MOXIE'S is a really nice place to eat and the staff therein are very sweet. However avoid the SHARK CLUB which left me throwing up for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs! Bed bugs! Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: moniaudio
Reviews.Content: Need I really say more. But I will. The staff was not helpful at all with the Bed Bugs issue. They would not move us, since we were stuck here for a month during the Olympics. Then they wouldn't clean our clothes either. Our Bosses had to step in. DO NOT STAY HERE EVER!!!!! JUST STAY CLEAR OF ANY SANDMAN HOTEL IF YOU KNOW WHATS GOOD FOR YOU!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only use the Sandman Downtown as a LAST RESORT”
Reviews.Author: k2pooh
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying BED BUGS. In our group of 70 people, after just one week, 4 of them have bed bugs bits/infections. The only thing the hotel did was move them to a different room. They did not clean their clothes, they did not offer them anything such as bar/food voucher for the inconvenience and mainly, they NEVER apologized. They didn't even offer to pay for the medical expenses that occurred as they are all on antibiotics, ibuprofen and topical cream. Please, search this problem with this hotel you will see it's an on going problem. If it wasn't for the fact that every hotel is booked (it's the Olympics) we would be moving to a different hotel. The costumer service is awful. They are very short and really don't give much assistance when asking for help. Many of us reserved refrigerators weeks prior to our arrival, only to find out there wasn't one in the room when we arrived. We've been asking daily for over a week for one, to no avail. We've given up. So seriously, unless this is the last hotel, I WOULD NOT STAY HERE. You literally are putting your health in risk.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Calgarybiztrip
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver late November for interviews and decided to stay at Sandman Downtonw due to it's close proximity to the business district. The service I received from the time of check in to my departure was truly execptional. I relied on the staff for directions to the my many destinations including; tourist spots, restaurants etc. I will definitely be staying there the next time I visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Value”
Reviews.Author: SeattlePassenger
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel almost one week each month. The staff knows me and treats me well. I often receive upgrades to superior rooms. Internet works, clean rooms, excellent restaurants, location is right next to where I work. Great value for a business traveler as the Westin and Hampton in same neighborhood rates are much higher. Much to do when you close the laptop as YaleTown and Stadiums are just blocks away. If you are a frequent business traveler speak to the front desk, they will take care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Cant Wait to be Back in a month”
Reviews.Author: Ocean_Girlyyz
Reviews.Content: On my first trip to Vancouver my Boyfriend and I were very budget conscience. My boyfriend had been making frequent trips to Vancouver and used to fill me in on how beautiful Vancouver was. We took a short vacation. We found the Sandman Gerogia street to have a huge deal on hotwire. We got to the city early, Sandman Staff held our bags until a room was ready to be checked in. It was nice of the housekeeping manager who cleaned one of the rooms early and gave us teh room at 10am.Once we got into the hotel our toilet was clogged. Maintenance was up to repair it within 30 minutes. We were tired after the Red eye flight, decided to have a shower, requested additional set of towels. The hotel staff had them in the room within 20 minutes. I cannot express how perfect the location was. Very central, within a comfortable distance to everything; waterfront, to Shopping on Robson and many restaurants. I was very impressed with the service and the hospitality of the Staff and management. My boyfriend's Company is now exclusively using Sandman hotel's Group of Hotel's through out BC. I have stayed at their Toronto Location this past week as a girl's night out. It's excellent service, price we pay for the 31/2 Star with the service and luxury of 4 or 5 diamond property, is truly " Home Away from Home" Feel. My families and I try to stay with the Sandman Chain as much as possible. I wish they would put more hotels in Ontario. ~Cant wait for my next trip during Olympics, Sandman Vancouver here we come ...

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home - cheerful personable staff and my favourite hotel in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: BCGrog
Reviews.Content: I'm a professional business traveler. I stay in hotels all over the province of BC - for a minimum 2 weeks a month. This hotel has been my home away from home in Vancouver going on over 7 years now. I stay there every 4 to 6 weeks, usually 3+ nights a stay. I can stay at any hotel I wish, but I have come to love this hotel for many reasons. When I walk in the lobby I always feel like I do when I enter my best friend's home. The staff - front counter, room cleaners, maintenance - always and as far back as I remember cheerfully greet you and genuinely make you feel like they are happy you arrived. They always look you in the eye in elevators, hallways or even the parkade with a cheerful "Good Morning" or "Have a nice sleep" . I have yet to encounter any staff at this hotel that aren't bright and cheerful - which is amazing and must be challenging because how many people they must process and cater to everyday - and we know how demanding some of us can be right? Even the managers sometimes come out to greet the customers just to say hi and make sure everything is just right with their accommodations. The rooms are always clean. It is an older building, elegant and nicely decorated. The rooms are comfortable and the decor and furniture are top notch. The hotel offers excellent amenities - full service, excellent pool, a gym, two restaurants - Moxies ( great room service ) and the Shark Club to pick from for dinner. The location is fantastic - the QE theater, GM Place and BC Place are kitty corner. Georgia Street is the main artery of downtown Vancouver. Everything connects to it. Being right at the end of Georgia just before the viaduct makes it perfect for those that want to get in and out of downtown fast by car - just one right turn out of the breezeway and Georgia is right there, another right and you're driving on the viaduct to zip down to Main Street, then First Ave to get to Hwy 1. Turn left to go downtown, to Stanley Park, or over the Lions Gate Bridge to the North Shore. Bottom line is ingress/egress by vehicle to this hotel is awesome because it is on the edge of downtown. This hotel is an excellent jump off point for anyone either tourist or business traveler. For the business traveler like me, rest assured the high speed wireless internet is great. I just got home tonight after a week there - and all week I was receiving and responding to 30 emails a day and downloading and uploading upwards of 1 to 1.5 megs of data per session. I had no service drop outs. I had good speed each night all night for all 5 nights. My wife calls me every night a couple times a night when I am there on business. She comments all the time how personable, cheerful and nice the people are at the front desk whenever she calls. Do yourself a favour and give this hotel a try next time you are in town - you'll be really happy with all the service and the great rates.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: d_phillips69
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a business meeting-called ahead to see about an early check in- was told no problem...but- when I arrived-the lady said rather rudely that check in was at 4pm...we waited another 2 hours- and at 4pm checked in,got our keys and went to my room,only to find that they had given our room to someone else- even walked in on the couple laying in bed, who said they had checken in 2 hours ago (the same time we were supposed to be getting that very room) I was sooooo embarassed. We went to the front desk where the same rude lady acted as if it was a simple mistake- I told her that it seemed as though me early check in room was given away and that they realized it too late- but that there ws no need to be rude- she huffed under her breath- and reactivated our room cards for a different room- not even a discount or appology- it was as though we were an inconvenience to her...got into the room finally and after all that- should've gone next door to the YWCA -even it is better than this dump...NEVER WILL RETURN AGAIN!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: AngieT15
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay when we were in Vancouver! Great people and a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Book the Hampton Inn and Suites down the street instead!!”
Reviews.Author: TheHipsterTripster
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Sandman City Centre on Georgia Street due to my company's booking and I am very sorry to say that nothing has changed since the last reviewer stayed here in October 2009. It is only one month away from the Olympics and the dark, dingy rugs are still dirty and stained, the furniture all banged up and broken and there is a film of grease or something on all the surfaces and walls. I am extremely disappointed in this hotel and this being my first time in British Columbia I am terribly upset that this has to be my first impression. If it wasn't raining so much, I'd be out of the hotel as much as I could. I know praying for sunny weather in Vancouver's Winter is a pipe dream, but I believe in miracles. If my company doesn't move us out of here I may just have to dig into my own pockets and come up with the cash to stay at the Hampton Inn and Suites which is just down the block. I went in to check it out and it is fabulous! Clean, bright, spacious and just a whole different warm feeling from the moment you walk in the door. I wish Sandman would look to them for an example. Come on Sandman don't you want people to go home with good memories of their stay with you, eh?

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: jorgUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sandman Hotel for two nights, after the first night we found Bedbugs in our bed , this was the start of a 4 week holiday and it sure spoilt the rest of the trip. They moved us to another room and told us we could have the first night free, still trying to get the money via Canadian Affair. As you might imagine every stop after that my wife was looking for Bedbugs, that became a real pain, we spent the last 5 days in Edmonton at my BILaws house, he was not to keen on having the suitcases in doors just in case. This is a Hotel I would never visit again, JW

Reviews.Title: “good location poor quality”
Reviews.Author: terrucker
Reviews.Content: was in a good location but overhaul of very poor quality

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here.”
Reviews.Author: PCBSML
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver for a business trip and the Sandman was suggested by my client. My wife and I checked in, were told 10 times not to leave anything in our car. There were no bellmen to help with luggage. The room was small, dark, every piece of furniture was damaged. The carpets had not been washed...perhaps ever. To sit on the toilet you had to rotate 30 degrees since the seat was hard up against a cabinet. We literally checked the sheets before we got in bed. In addition, with all the cautions from the staff, we never felt particularly safe in the building. To be fair, we were told that the "other tower is newer", but that didn't do us much good since the check in staff strongly suggested we not stay there "since the hockey fans are a bit loud" after that evening's game. There are lots of great places to stay in Vancouver. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Location Makes Up for What Room Lacks”
Reviews.Author: VIVA_WORLD
Reviews.Content: Just a short review of our stay at the Sandman City Center in downtown Vancouver. The staff was nice, the hotel was clean, but the beds were terrible. The sheets were so scratchy that I awoke in the morning with what appeared to be rug burn on my elbows? They were bright red, and so sensitive that my shirt rubbing on them hurt. The bed was very hard too. The room size was super small with a bed, desk, table/chairs, TV crammed into it, but I think this is quite common in downtown hotels in big cities. This is my second stay here, and I will return, the reason being that the location is unbeatable, and overall is a nice place to stay for a night (wouldn't stay any longer because of the bed issue). We went to a hockey game right across the street at GM place. The bar downstairs is perfect for a few snacks and pre-game drinks, for a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “B&E NAD A FINAL INVOICE????”
Reviews.Author: victravellers
Reviews.Content: I went to Vancouver for a Canucks game and U2 concert. My boyfriend and I went out for a bit to see to city, upon return of to our room we find our hotel room door broken in half and all of our personal belongings thrown about. Two maintenance men were waiting for us in the hall and guarding what was left in the room. My camera all all of my gear was taken, valued at $2000. The GM Mr Lopez shows up introduced himself and explains what happened and that there has been a police call made. We get a new room. We are then informed that the hotel is not legally responsible for anything that is stolen. The hotel informed us that if we had used their 'safe and secure boxes' the camera would have been safe, the room is not a safe place to store our valuables. So on day two i ask to check a bag, when i go and retrieve it, the desk person said 'right this way' let us enter their room and take whatever bag was ours, WITHOUT CHECKING OUR ID, safe and secure... Bull [--]. We also found out that there is no surveillance cameras in the hotel except for in the parkade and at the front desk. We do get the first of two nights free, the night of the b&e, and the second night at a reduced rate... it's funny they think we should pay to have a robbery. We, after 3 days of fighting with hotel management, get the 2nd night for free. After we talk to the Sandman's regional manager. Now that i am back at home i am STILL dealing with insurance, police and telling everyone i know never to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “I must have been a fortunate guest as I enjoyed my stay at the Sandman”
Reviews.Author: Vixenthefoxylady
Reviews.Content: Reading through the July and August reviews it almost seems that people are talking about a different hotel. Me and my husband stayed there at the start of September and found the hotel to be very pleasent. The room was spacious and clean, the bed was extremely comfortable and the staff were pleasent. The views weren't great, but hey your in Vancouver, just take a walk around town if you want to see something nice! The only slightly annoying thing was the lifts and the stupid security cards you had to use, which frequently did not work....oh and the noisy ice vending machine outside our room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly happy with the Sandman”
Reviews.Author: Hardygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sandman twice within two weeks, once for two nights and once for five. The first room was quite small, but I found it adequate and appreciated the fact that there were plenty of electric points. The second room was larger with a better view - I agree with another reviewer, request a room facing the stadium.OK - no one would go to the Sandman for a romantic weekend , it's a busy hotel that caters for groups and concert goers but that said, I found the staff friendly , the location excellent and rooms perfectly adequate. Oh, and I also liked the swimming pool!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: jkirby2007
Reviews.Content: no toilet paper upon checking...took 45 min to get it: TV reception very bad. Internet unreliable, Kept going off: No Hot water the first morning: Pigeons home was outside on window ledge: Fan in bathroom so loud you could not talk while it was on: Passcard for room had to be re-programmed 5 times: two elevators in hotel...very slow and also had to be used by the room service staff: We used stairs several times: No room service although restaurant was four floors below: This room simply was not worth $139.00 a night. Saw comments from hotel stating they are upgrading. Sorry....no work was being done and no signs stating this. The only good thing about this hotel is the staff, as they are doing the best they can under the circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Not good - worst hotel on our 14 day tour”
Reviews.Author: EssexPalin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in two diiferent rooms. Its not that great im afraid. The hotel feels tied/dated/worn. The air-con works but makes so much noise its unusable at night - its looks like its from a museum! The lifts are bad, you wait ages for them - we resorted to the stairs from the several floors up. The glazing is old so rooms street side are very noisey. Customer service is below average. Moxies attched to the hotel (but not sure if its part of it) serves breakfast but found service very poor when we had an issue - the matter was dealt with in very unproffesional manner and we didnt go back. On the plus side its close to down town (about 10mins walk), thats about it! My tip - STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE! On the whole Vancouver is a great place with friendly helpful people but there are far too many down-and-outs and something needs to be done as it takes the shine off. In all the places in the world Ive been to this city has the most.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Appalling - will never recommend it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Noemi_K
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 12 nights, without realizing we were being eaten alive by bed bugs… until one day we woke up covered in huge pink dots. At first we believed we were allergic to some mosquito bites. However, knowing that I am not allergic to pretty much anything, we checked with a doctor who confirmed to us these were bed bugs bites. We of course went back to the hotel’s management who, once we showed them, knew exactly what we had and offered to wash our clothes the next day and moved us into a new room. And oh, gave us 2 vouchers of 10 dollars each for food in the hotel’s restaurant. Our expenses to treat these horrible bites cost us over 100 dollars, not to mention the amount of washing we had to do. I don’t even think we got an apology from the management. Still now, a week after we departed that hotel, we are pretty much covered in disgusting bites and more coming out. We can barely enjoy the remainder of our Canadian holiday and we pretty much have to cover up the arms, legs and faces as we really look diseased. I know and understand bed bugs are hard to avoid, but since the hotel has this issue and had it before, at least they could do is give you enough info on medicine to treat such bites and a fact sheet on these bugs, offer a 24 hour laundry service, assure you the new bedroom they move you into will be free of bugs and do their best to comfort you while you go through such a horrible experience. The only good things about that place was the sports bar and the restaurant food, which I believe are under external management and not owned by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Harper23
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Sandman, there was a fire fighter/police officer convention going on, the restaurant and surrounding streets were noisy and crowded. The hotel is attached to restaurants, bars and a public fitness center, it just felt noisy and very public throughout the open lobby. Now that I think back on it, the hotel just felt chaotic. Upstairs in the rooms, it was more quiet. We stayed with family and had 3 rooms amongst us. The room my boyfriend and I had was cramped-feeling, smelled like smoke, and was dark. Our view was of the radio station across the street. My mother's room had a great expansive view, so if you do stay at the Sandman, I would recommend asking for a corner room facing the stadium! We were within walking distance of Yaletown, which is a fun area, but we were also close to some seedy sections so just make sure you know where you're going or drive.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed !!”
Reviews.Author: JohnBKent_England
Reviews.Content: With bed bugs, noisy aircon and traffic noise our very brief stay was not a happy one! Unfortunately the hotel was part of a package and we had no choice. The hotel is in need of a major refit, including new beds !! We eventually managed to negotiate a move to the Sandman Suites on Davie Street, which was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting hotel - DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: MCG_123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sandman in Vancouver as part of a Contiki tour of Canada. Very shabby room, poor customer service. Located in a dodgy part of town in an incredibly ugly concrete building. Several people in our party were bitten by bedbugs - most of the rooms seem to have a problem with bedbugs. I did not want to get into the bed, so I used my own sleeping bag on top of the covers and was fine, but you really shouldn't have to do that at a hotel! Avoid if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: downhambridge
Reviews.Content: Ideal location at the lower end of Georgia Street, 10 minute walk to China Town and only 3 or 4 mins more to Gas Town. A 15 minute walk will see you in the heart of downtown Vancouver. A 10 minute $10 cab ride will see you at theCanada Place cruise terminal. Rooms are spacious and comfortable and a decent choice of bars and eateries within the hotel. Prices are very reasonable and car parking is underground .

Reviews.Title: “You're paying for location”
Reviews.Author: wkmitch
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Excellent location for events at GM place / going downtown - Secure parking ($11 a night) Cons: - Window was covered in bird poop - Carpet between bathroom and bed was soaking wet - Pigeons created a next in the wall between rooms. Could hear them all night - Elevators take FOR EVER to get to your floor and when they do you have to pack in like sardines - Not worth the price (We paid $200 for 2 people, 1 night) I guess you are paying for location

Reviews.Title: “Fire Alarm at 4am, emergency exits blocked !!!”
Reviews.Author: avb210
Reviews.Content: Summary: I hope this company learns there lesson that things could have been worse with BLOCKED EMERGENCY EXITS, NO LIGHTED EXIT SIGNS IN THE HALLWAYS AND NO DIRECTION MAP FOR EXITS ON THE HOTEL ROOM DOORS. Lets start with the fact that the front desk staff let us know that because we didnt book directly with them, that we were not elgible for a free up grade and to call them directly and they will match expedia etc... WHY WOULD YOU TELL ME THIS IF I WAS NOT ELGIBLE......Got over it off and went on with my night. ****4am in the morning fire alarms went off, smoke filled the 3rd floor or at least that what i thought. Nope someone let the smoke extinguishers off and filled the air, couldnt see anything.. Why couldnt I find the emergency exit. 1: NO MAP on the back of my door and 2: NO EXIT SIGNS that were lite up, just a white sign that says stairs. In a hallway of smoke you cant see ANYTHING. Ran down the stairs to get to the bottom of the emergency exit that was BLOCKED OFF with lumber (Crown molding i think) a few feet tall that people had to climb over. What would have happened if this was a real fire......Fire department fanned out that floor and the staff send us back to sleep in a room filled with fire extinguisher smoke...who sleeps in that!!!!! Got moved to another room after an hour of asking for someone to help move my stuff to a new room. Finally once the police came, the staff helped me move my stuff to another room. Spoke with the day manager the next morning and again made us feel horrible that we used a third party company (example expedia) to book our hotel stay and couldnt do anything for us for what we went through. She did ask if we would stay there again and maybe give us a little discount next time... Next time!!!!!!!! I said I wold never stay here every again. She then said that shes had people in the past that were unhappy and stayed with then the second time and very happy... ahahahahahahah.. I guess I am not the only unhappy customer..... I hope this company learns there lesson that things could have been worse with BLOCKED EMERGENCY EXITS, NO LIGHTED EXIT SIGNS IN THE HALLWAYS AND NO DIRECTION MAP FOR EXITS ON THE HOTEL ROOM DOORS. I hope everyone reads this and knows how unsafe this hotel is......

Reviews.Title: “Messing with the elevators most of the time”
Reviews.Author: GoCanucksGo2
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the hotel as to be close to GM Place for a Canucks game. I really enjoyed the close proximity to the venue and that is the main reason we stayed there. I was very disappointed with all the time we had wasted in the elevator as the security cards were not being read properly and it was very frustrating trying to get off onto the proper floor. Also found a very rude waitress in Moxie's that seemed that she could not handle the busy crowds too well. Service there was poor as the wait for a table she said could be up to 3 hrs. (For two people?) Wow! Sorry but we a game to catch so we opted instead to grab some food at the arena instead of wasting time waiting some more. I would stay at the hotel again as long as the elevator problem had been fixed as I would not want to go through that torture again and would probably find another local restaurant in case the hotel was booked solid.

Reviews.Title: “bedbugs & a mouse!”
Reviews.Author: sozeyaknow
Reviews.Content: This shabby hotel needs work. The first room I had was next to the elevator, which made a lot of noise. It was a tiny room, all bed, hardly any floor space, and no drawers for clothes. I called and asked for another room and they obliged. It was bigger (still no dresser drawers) and farther from the elevator. Called for room service: "We don't deliver to your tower when it's this busy." Oh. Went to cash traveler's cheques at the front desk. "I have a small float. I can only cash $100 today." Oh. I woke up the next day with a couple of red bites on my side. The day after, more bites on my arms and hands. I was sitting on the bed working on my laptop when a little mouse ran across the room. My final straw. I went down to the front desk to let them know. They offered me another room. I said I'd look and see. It smelled horribly of cigarette smoke. I got on expedia and got myself booked at another hotel (which was fantastic - Century Plaza Hotel and Spa). I asked if they'd received word of these problems before. "Well, definitely the mouse is a first." (Meaning, yes, we've heard of the bedbugs). "And I wonder how it got all the way up to the 11th floor?" (This said skeptically, as if I was possibly imagining or making up the mouse?) Also, "Are your bites itchy?" "Yes," I replied. "Well bedbug bites don't itch. They hurt." "Then perhaps your hotel has given me fleas." (By the way, bedbug bites DO itch. These were definitely bedbugs.) Sandman offered no rebate or anything at all for any of my troubles. Incidentally, Sandman Hotel was close to GM stadium which had hockey games going on. So the whole hotel seemed jam-packed with loud, drunk men with their faces painted, carrying cases of beer, and making a lot of noise. If that's your thing, and you don't mind bedbugs or mice, or shabby surroundings, or being jammed in an elevator with drunk hockey fans, and don't need to cash traveler's cheques, or want room service, you will love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: krispix011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July of this year. We were in town for a bachelorette party and we had two rooms. When we booked, we had asked for adjoining rooms or two rooms on the same floor if adjoining rooms were not available. We booked 2 or 3 months in advance. When we arrived, we were told that only one room was ready (there was about 10 of us all together). So all of us had to get ready for our evening in one room, with one bathroom. Two hours later, our other room was still not available, apparently the guests staying in it had decided to stay another night. We checked in at about 3:30 and we didn't understand how the hotel didn't already know this little fact when we checked in. We had to phone down and REMIND them that we were still waiting. So we get a second room 4 floors up, not on the same floor like we had requested. The room was under construction. No beds, nothing. So we go back to the front desk and they give us a third room. The worst part was that they were indifferent to the massive inconvenience they were causing us. Mixing up rooms is one thing but having no motivation to fix the problem or not being at all apologetic is quite another. We will never stay here again, which is a shame because the location is great and Moxies is a great restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the sandman”
Reviews.Author: stevewhite66
Reviews.Content: myself my wife and 2 children stayed at the Sandman in vancouver and were very worried with the write ups we saw prior to coming out fron England. How wrong we were to be worried. The Hotel is situated in the most convinient part of town for visiting Vancouver with excellent shops and restaurents nearby, we would recommend Rickys Diner for breakfast. The Hotel staff were very very helpful and also very cheerful and polite to myself and my family. The Hotel was clean, tidy and safe and never once had a problem with the lifts. The pool is cool but thats the way most people like it rather than hot........but if you like hot there is a Hot Tub!!! All I can say is this hotel was first class and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Terrified”
Reviews.Author: samxmalone
Reviews.Content: The Sandman was not my first pick for a place to stay. My sister and her boyfriend and I were going to Vancouver for the Madonna concert and The Sandman was the only place with availability left. When we entered our unit my sister and I did an inspection. We work in the hospitality industry as well and were appalled with what we found. There was a used needle under the bed and in the bathroom it appeared they hadn't washed the seat in YEARS. There was brown goo on the toilet seat and we were afraid to even use the thing. I will never stay there again, and everyone, to avoid this situation book your stay FAR in advance so you don't have to settle and stay at a place like this.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting room”
Reviews.Author: GJMPerth
Reviews.Content: The Sandman Downtown Vancouver was the worst hotel experience we have ever encountered in all our travelling. Attached is a photo. This picture shows the window of our room, with the streaks you see on the glass being bird droppings. The unit in view outside the window is a part of the hotel's airconditioning unit, which ran 24 hours per day keeping us awake all night. The room was cramped with nowhere for two people to store two suite cases and the towels provided by the hotel were threadbare. Room 304 at the Sandman Downtown Vancouver should never have been used as a guest room, given the smallness of its size and more importantly due to the continual noise of the airconditioning unit running immediately outside the room window. When we enquired about changing our room we were told the hotel was fully booked because of a football match on at the stadium in the next street. We had booked our hotel almost a year ago as part of a package and presumably paid the rack rate for our accomodation. It seems to me that the hotel saw we were from out of town and would presumably never be back in that part of the world so gave us the worst possible room and provided locals in town for the football match with the better accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location Location !!!”
Reviews.Author: Backpacker76
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at this hotel in early August for a convention plus I arrived a day early to take in the sights. I was bit hesitant to stay there after reading some of the reviews, but their excellent rate was hard to pass on. The best aspect of this property is its location - you are in the center of the action and all the major attractions can be reached by foot. Public transport is immediately available. The staff is also excellent and was on the ball with maps and directions. Cabs camped at the door with no waiting when I left early morning. The rooms themselves were average. I was expecting a little bigger room, but the bed was comfortable. I wanted to be upgraded to a King suite, but it was not available at the time. You might get a great view if you are up high enough. Overall, it was a decent stay there. If I ever come back to Vancouver, I wouldn't mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Avoided”
Reviews.Author: Dave501
Reviews.Content: First the good things if you can get a room on the 10th floor or above facing north you get a good view from your window. Second the tv in our room was lcd. The hotel is also in a very convenient location. The room was just faded 80`s style furnishings (not retro just very weary). The main thing you most avoid is the swimming pool its unhygenic with a layer of brown grease all around the tiles at the water surface, the changing area is just as bad. Its also old run down and in my opinion dangerous dont let your children use it. How it gets through Hygiene and Safety inspections i dont know never seen a pool in this condition open to the public anywhere. Should be closed immediately, The lifts are old and no longer suitable for the number of floors. Use this hotel only if your desperate.

Reviews.Title: “not that bad”
Reviews.Author: aussie_rose64
Reviews.Content: we were abit worried after reading some of reviews here, but it wasn't as bad as we thought. the room was quite small but we only spent on night here after our rocky mountaineer journey. though small the room was mostly comfortable. with the window open we could hear abit of street noise but with the window closed it was ok. we ate at the hotel restaurant 'moxie' i think its called and that was ok too. the place is good for a night stayover. staff were friendly and helpful and the room was clean, not much else to tell really

Reviews.Title: “A bit of both bad a good!”
Reviews.Author: greatshang
Reviews.Content: A big downside...The elevators did not work at all and sometimes kept bringing me into the wrong floors, or was a long wait for the elevator to come, so I had to take the stairs all the time! Also the rooms were very dark and lights did not work all the time! and a bad view of the alley which was also very dark and dinghy. The bathroom had no lock. The pool was QUITE hard to find with the winding hallway! Many shady people outside the hotel. Some good things: Lobby quite clean and fancy and desk service is pleasant. GREAT location, close to skytrain, bus and shopping. Nice restaurant and bar,

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: rich13
Reviews.Content: Noted the different reviews before asking the travel agent to book this hotel. On arrival Reception staff couldn't find booking (don't know who was to blame for this - we had a written booking form). We were quickly given a room, but unfortunately the bathroom had not been cleaned - the rest of the room had. We called Reception who put this right immediately - the cleaners were apologetic and throughout our stay always friendly and helpful. However, naturally, we were beginning to think we should have listened to the reviewers who did not rate this hotel - and we were to be there for 3 nights!! Fortunately nothing else went wrong - we had a reasonable sized room, no view - we weren't bothered as only sleeping there and the rate we paid was low - very clean and comortable room, good TV and channel choice, excellent air conditioning (we thought it was ok first night but the hotel clearly didn't - on return to the hotel they had installed a new unit - it made quite a difference - well done) and clean towels every day. We used Moxy's bar a couple of times - very friendly staff - didn't have a meal there but what we saw looked good. This hotel is very convenient for downtown and the harbour and within easy walking distance of the football and ice hockey stadiums as well as the science world/omnimax (a great place for kids of all ages - and adults!!!). The lifts are often mentioned in reviews and they can be extremely busy at times causing a wait - but they are ok and the key card access to fall floors gives some added security not found in many upmasrket hotels apaprt from business floors. Checkout was very efficient and a taxi to the airport (more efficient than a 6-block walk to theairport shuttle bus - taxi cost CA$30, Airporter bus CA$27 for two). We were pleased to see the building of a direct train link to the airport, due to open in 2009 - a good spin-off from the 2010 Winter Olympics I guess. Lots of new building in Vancouver since our last visit 10 years ago but still loved the city and its surrounding area. I agree with some other reviewers that there are more vagrants/beggars than we are used to and could be off-putting if anyone felt vulnerable - I note the BC Premier promises to improve the position - he really needs to. Gastown, for example, is excellent but you don't have to stray far away from it to find the seedier side of the city - a pity. With a bit of thought and care there is no need to have any worries we thought. I am sure there are many better hotels in Vancouver than the Sandman but doubless many worse. Overall, we are satisfied that we got good value for money and weren't disappointed, given the low rate for our stay. And the city remains wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for concerts--Rooms need improvement”
Reviews.Author: cynlouhoo
Reviews.Content: Frankly, based on the reviews, I hesitated before booking this hotel. However, we are not exactly wealthy, and our fave concert hotel--The Georgian Court, has recently raised rates to what was outside our budget. Anyway, I think our room was in the South Tower, but I am not positive (building looked old). The room was small, but reasonably decorated. The balcony area was gross and looks as though nobody ever cleans it. There were cigarette (and other) butts, beer cans, and a used face cloth out there. Yuck! The bed was comfy and we don't seem to have fallen prey to bed bugs- thank goodness! Upon check in the pillows were not even on the bed, so the maid must've forgotten to complete our room (hopefully the sheets were clean). The bathroom needed a spring cleaning (grout dirty) and the blow dryer wasn't properly secured to the wall. On the plus side we liked the shower head and water pressure, and of course the curved shower rod. We probably won't return, since for way cheaper we could have stayed at the YWCA hotel for a very similar room (but cleaner).

Reviews.Title: “Missing it already!”
Reviews.Author: MissKitty08_8
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed at the Sandman hotel for 2 weeks in a twin bedroom! The size and the layout of the room was perfect! We also had a gorgeous view from the window (which was huge) of North Vancouver, which included Grouse mountain! It was easy to identify Grouse mountain at nightime as some of it was lit up. The layout of the bathroom was ideal as well! When you walked into the bedroom, there was a small archway on the left hand side to enter the first part of the bathroom! Here you had the sink, folded ironing board and a rail for your clothes. You then went through a door to get access to everything else! This was ideal because if I was having a bath, my mum could still use the sink for whatever! All staff were lovely and helpful! Whenever we bumped into any of the reception staff or maids in the corridors or in the lifts, they always smiled and said hello! Brilliant location as well! Robson St was parallel to West Georgia so it took us no time at all to get there and about 5 minutes to reach the shopping area! Pacific centre was also a 5 minute walk on West Georgia! Chinatown & Gastown were also 5-10 minutes away! If you don't fancy having breakfast in the hotel there as some good places nearby! 'The midnight garden' (I think that's what its called) was a cafe on West Georgia and took about 3 minutes to walk down to. Lovely food and reasonably priced! Then on Robson, you had McDonalds, Subway and another cafe which specialised in crepe breakfasts! Other conveniant places within 5 minutes walking distance from the hotel - post office, sky train, bank and drugstore! The little things worth saying - free apples at reception, touch screen tv in the lobby which gives information on everything from attractions, shopping, restaurants etc and a self check in service! I had such a brilliant two weeks in Vancouver and would definetly stay at the Sandman again! The only complaint that I have is that the lifts were really slow sometimes, but thats nothing major! Hope you enjoy your trip :)

Reviews.Title: “the most unhygenic hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: holiDublin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Sandman Downtown vancouver in April of this year whilst on honeymoon in the States first we spent a few days in New York, then a week in San Francisco and a week in Vancouver while the other destinations were flawless The Sandman was an utter disgrace to be graded a 3 star hotel and unfortaunetly have to say it was an honest reflection of downtown Vancouver n(miserable, and dirty) on the night we arrived we had booked a Queen size room fully aircon and to what we expected a good standard. we arrived at 1.30am were greeted by night manager checked in quite promptly all seemed ok if you turned the lights down ignored the fact the front doors had an out of order sign please use side entrance and the rotten apple core,s sitting on a table in the main foyae. at this stage we were already thinking uhh.. as we were tired we proceeded to our room on the 8th floor assisted by the porter who brought up our luggage, we entered our room and without even turning the light on could see a crubby chair that resembled something out of a tip that had been fire damaged, turned lights on and looked around rest of room the bathroom well lets just say its just aswell I am not over 10st with a 30 inch waist otherwise I was in trouble. you could have had a shower reamained sitting on the toilet and had a shave in the sink all at the one time. that was assuming you did not mind other peoples hair all over everything you touched, the bed sheets had cigarrette burns and dirt stuck to them and when we pulled them back we found more hair and stains on sheets, with this we phoned the manager and asked for a clean room as this one was of dismal standard and above all filthy, he apoligised and brought up the key to another room on a lower floor and was also a corporate suite on the corporate side of hotel, with that in mind we agreed and moved are luggage to our new room and surprise surprise if I had have booked and paid for a corporate room I would have been disgusted I was not but we were equally disguted at standard, filthy couches, carpet bed sheets with burns the usual at this stage and hair every where, I picked up the phone and once again asked for the manager to come up to our SUITE and see what he had expected us to stay in, there was a clump of hair the size of an average Gerbal on the floor by the bed the bathroom had hair stuck to tiles mirror and toilet seat, I should the manager and he did not comment to much but said he had another suite free and would check it personaly himself to ensure it was clean before showing us, he did this and returned briefly to show us room at this stage my partner wanted to check out to an alternative hotel but given that it was around 3am it was to late, I went with manager to other room and had a quick look in bathroom aswell as pulling back bed sheets and that was enough of that, I showed him what he had just deemed as being clean and left him speechless, we stayed in the first suite sleeping sitting up on chairs as we refused to sleep in someone elses hair. Following morning we approached a different manager and she apoligised over what happened and ensured our room would be deep cleaned and she would oversee it personaly and offered to give us half rate which we declined stating all we wanted was a clean room which she agreed and gave us assurances it would be sorted, We had not unpacked any of our stuff at this stage and just freshened up to head out for day with the knowledge our room would be cleaned and that left us a bit more comfortable, the clump of hair i had left in the drawer beside bed if I must say dileberatly to see how thorough the room was cleaned and to my own surprise was shocked to find it remained in the room that evening when we returned along with a bottle of wine and an apoligy, on our departure from the hotel I handed an envelope to manager who had said she would supervise the cleaning of the room and explained it had been left in the room through all the supposed cleaning that had been done in room, I also told her that I am by profession a Manager of a 4 star Hotel in Ireland and the main area I am responsible for by choice is Health and Hygiene and theirs I found to be a disgrace, Thank God once you go outside the downtown area of Vancouver that makes up for it, I have to say it is Sp[ectacular

Reviews.Title: “Disco nearby !”
Reviews.Author: fiftysix01
Reviews.Content: Not on the airporter bus route anymore, meant a taxi ride. Room adequate to good, but on a front corner across the road from a Disco. They even "performed" on Sunday. Beware. Parking lot opposite not noisy. Beds firm and wonderful after a long flight and next days. Shower super, and we stayed under for more than 3 minutes and felt guilty, coming from a drought city. "Scone Witch" for breakfast as recommended by a previous adviser was just that a scone with a little egg in it. We didn't do it again. We allowed time for the lifts, thanks to previous advice. Front of house very helpful, as cleaners. Nice to hear an Australian accent on our arrival. Good blackout drapes worked to stop light in longer days. Restaurant attached to hotel easy and efficient. Nice meals, good selection. Public transport close {one or two blocks} and easy to use. Should have asked for courtyard room, when booking and would have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Ummmmm”
Reviews.Author: rsnowNorthDevon
Reviews.Content: Finding the way in to the entrance is one thing let alone the underground parking! We did it! We had 2 rooms for the 5 of us, 1 with a view of a concrete wall and the other great..not very clean , dreadful bathroom .. grotty...tiny..on plug air con not working properly... seemed slow to help, stinky pool... ate at Moxies the restaurant in the Hotel always been a good bet, not this time! expensive and poor quality...

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it......”
Reviews.Author: smam2001
Reviews.Content: Unexpected we needed accommodation in Vancouver , we were limited on availability and ended up at the Sandman Hotel. The rooms were dated and the beds uncomfortable, we spent two nights without hot water as the whole of the north tower had plumbing problems . I didn't find the staff very friendly and reception was always just full of suitcases from the coach parties that arrived daily . Best thing about this hotel was the view from the room.

Reviews.Title: “No Way!!”
Reviews.Author: mac1CrieffScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights here and can't say much good about any of them. I had booked a twin room and we were given a double. This was rectified the next day but the room was the same tired, decor as Calgary. The check in manager was at pains to tell us that it was still a family owned chain. Well it's time the family tried staying at some of their hotels. The bedside lamp was faulty but the girl who came to check it said just give it a wiggle!! The towels you could spit through,the decor needed an uplift more than me and all together we were glad to go. Incidentally we found Vancouver had a lot of down and outs, a couple of whom bedded down close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is a classic 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: andy1881
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my wife and in-laws and can't really fault the place. The front desk staff were very friendly upon arrival and this continued throughout our stay providing some useful recommendations on places to eat. I found the rooms to be pretty spacious and extremely clean throughout. Our 'double' room had 2 queen size beds. Ask at front desk if you need Internet access and they will provide you with a box for your room, alternatively there is free wireless access in the lobby. The bars and restaurants in the hotel are really comfortable and serve really good food. The hotel has a good aspect looking towards North Vancouver with big windows and plenty of light in the rooms. I recommend asking for a north facing room on the 10th floor or above for the view although it isn't as good it used to be with the ever-heightening Vancouver skyline. The only negative points I would make are the rooms (especially bathrooms) could do with a little decoration and updating and the pool area feels a little run down being the only part of the hotel which felt slightly less clean.

Reviews.Title: “Sandman is a Dive”
Reviews.Author: sk8tiki
Reviews.Content: Sandman Hotel Vancouver is a dump. Lets get this clear right now, they have given us tonight’s stay free with a promise of changing our room in the morning and charging us $130 per night rather than the $175 they tried to charge for this dive of a cramped room. Let me start. The first thing noticed upon entering the allocated room is the strong smell of fresh enamel paint on the bathroom door, which was recently painted, reeked of paint fumes and not appropriately signed “Wet Paint”. Do you know how hard it is to remove enamel paint from your hands let alone clothing? Now using water and soap to do this is a time consuming process; but at the Sandman it is a painful process as there is no hot water. That is right, NO HOT WATER. At Midnight the gent on the front counter told me this problem had been rectified. However it is 6am now and there is only lukewarm water, not warm enough to use. Now I am not up early in the morning – I am still up late in the night; as it seems noise plays a big factor in ones inability to get some rest. In this case we had to sleep with the window open so as to get some fresh air and rest from the paint fumes. However I have coughed all night in reaction to the fumes and now have sore throat and headache. Not to worry, nothing a hot shower and glass of juice wont fix, ha ha; shower, yeah right; well at least I can still have my cold glass of juice; WRONG again as the room doesn’t come with a mini fridge. (apparently there aren’t enough for every room) Which is sad, I did bring juice and milk, oh well I can drink from the carton. That’s how you do it in cheap dodgy hotel/motels, plus the open window in middle of a Canadian winter has helped to keep the drinks and us freezing cold. Mmmm decor and presentation - well I am quite sure the photographs speak for themselves in this one. The wallpaper would have made my Great Grandma excited (during the depression). The beautiful use of British racing green splattered on the bathroom door to cover a very poor repair job where the door has had a hole kicked in, helps to create a sense of claustrophobia in the 1.5m x 2m bathroom, doesn’t even have soap holders in the shower. Perhaps a dropped cake of soap caused someone to slip and put their foot through the door while they were having a cold shower. Actually they could have just slipped on the wet floor; the first thing I noticed when I ran the shower for 10 minutes at Midnight to see if the water would heat up, was how water manages to make its way directly to the bathroom floor, from there the water has nowhere to go as there are no drainage points. Not to worry, we are all adults here - we can just mop it up. Providing one of you is willing to forfeit your cold shower as there are no extra towels. Now my colleague actually seems have fallen asleep; which is a problem as I need to quietly sneak over his side of this shoebox to lodge this rant for publication. Would you believe that the power point on this side of the room doesn’t work. I should just be thankful that we now have Internet access in our room; initially we were informed that if I wish to use the internet I must do so in the lobby where they have wireless. If you do come here, please whatever you do, only come here for the most amazing restaurant “Moxies” is it great, or to party in the downstairs night club. Think hard and long before staying at the Sandman Hotel Vancouver. Sandman Hotel = 1 star.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and nasty”
Reviews.Author: stillatit
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this hotel is its position within walking distance to Gas town ,China town and Library Square. The rooms are shabby although ours was clean. The heating was inadequate! ! The staff were not interested in rectifying the problem and on the whole were a surly bunch . Moxies was very expensive and the food only adequate and inconsistent. Ordered a steak sandwich on two occasions , one was delicious and the other almost inedible due to overpowering sauce over the whole thing. The hotel was very noisy. Loved Vancouver but would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “pretty average”
Reviews.Author: tobey4
Reviews.Content: room was small and cramped. had to line the bags up against the wall as no where to store them. bed was OK. seemed to be at the wrong end of town. Hard to find way into the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get!”
Reviews.Author: PDXPortland
Reviews.Content: Booked through an airline website - before reading the reviews! Location was convenient - check-in was very quick and efficient and it was good to have secure parking. The lifts worked well for the majority of the time - you have to use your room card to make the lift work. The pool was cold, but seemed clean enough. The room was a double - a bit small - but then for $84 a night inc. all taxes etc I wasn't expecting the Fairmont. The room was cleaned well each day by friendly staff and the beds clean and comfortable. There was a hockey game on so we expected some noise, but this didn't transpire. Overall - a good experience and I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sandman Downtown Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: jkelly
Reviews.Content: This is a generally cramped hotel with small halls, elevators, and rooms and disappointing maintenance of in-room bathrooms. The rooms were also quite loud with noise from the streets below as well as other rooms and the hallway. Check-in/out lines were quite long which may have been due to the BC Lions game but painful regardless at >10 minutes. This was definitely not worth the average room rate.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel from Hell”
Reviews.Author: BlearyTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disaster. Our room was cramped. The windows had bird doo on them. The air conditioner was functionally unuseable. the staff was rude and surly. The elevators jammed. The pool was unheated; it's tiles cracked and dangerous. I had no resolve by the head company who were equally as dismissive and condescending. I would never stay in a Sandman Hotel again. They stink big time!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good value cental hotel for exploring most of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: robingirl60
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in September 2007 and could not really fault the place. The room we had was clean and spacious with a huge comfortable bed. Can't comment on the food as we did not eat there at all (prefering to take our breakfast with the locals at "Rosie's on Robson"). Also we didn't use the pool (didn't have time!). The location was great for walking to the shops, restaurants, museums, Canada Place, The Lookout, Gastown, Chinatown, etc and little ferry boat to Granville Island. A bit far to walk to Stanley Park but easy to get a bus or taxi. The Shark Bar attached to the hotel was a very busy sports bar (full of TV screens and ice hockey supporters) so if you haven't been to a US/Canadian sports bar, I'd recommend taking a look. Overall a good value central hotel, as good as 3 * hotels in London, and about half the price! Why do people find so many things to complain about???

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic”
Reviews.Author: Bantryb
Reviews.Content: All right, so you book a tour and are assured that 3 star hotels are used. You know you're not going to get the Ritz, but this doesn't even remotely qualify as a 3 star hotel. Traveling with a group of 22, staying 1 night before going to Vancouver Island and 3 nights on our return. We must have played musical rooms with a third of the rooms in the hotel. First caution - many, if not most of these rooms are so run down that you are reluctant to place your head on the paper thin pillow for fear of what might crawl out of the woodwork. Mildew and mold in all 3 rooms I stayed in (similar experiences by my other travelers) bathrooms in most of the rooms so small that you can not shut the door and sit on the toilet (not suitable for large men or women) 1 bathroom was a decent size. Towels threadbare, peeling wallpaper, beds like rocks, cigarette butts all over the balcony floors. . . need I go on? Moxie's restaurant food was decent, but they were always short of wait staff. On the morning we were to leave 3 couples arrived 1 hour before we were to depart, only to be told (after a 20 minute wait for a table ) that there was no chance that they would get their meal on time before we were to leave. Avoid this hotel. Vancouver's a charming city, but unless you're going to the dome next door and don't care where you sleep, this hotel will definately damper your impression of a lovely town.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: quicktravel
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this hotel, I was very skeptical about what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised when we got there. We had a nice room in the North Tower ( a higher floor would have been better) and the amenities were quite acceptable. We enjoyed the Bar and I had a good breakfast at Maxis. You might have a longer wait there over the weekend. I thought the staff were very courteous and the location was close to lots of activities downtown. Just be careful not to go near the empty public parking lot next to the hotel after it is dark as there are some undesirables in that area. We enjoyed everything else in the hotel. The elevators worked well too.

Reviews.Title: “why the bad reviews?”
Reviews.Author: sample_city
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Sandman July/Aug 2007 for 8 nights yes the room was basic, but it was the cheapest hotel our travel agent offered us! yes the 2 lifts are slow, but hey! com'on! We personally found all the staff (from cleaners to reception) very helpful (especially Jesse on the front desk) The location ideal, within walking distance of everypart of Downtown Vancouver, Stanley Park, Gastown & the main bus/train terminus Didn't think much of the breakfasts/service at Moxie's but can recommend The Whitespot 5mins up Georgia Strongly recommend for food/drink/service in The Shark Bar next door 10/10!, altho it does get very busy when The BC Lions are at home Cannot understand the bad reviews! If you want to 'do' Vancouver on a budget, this IS the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Terpla
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of our tour package and I must say was below average for the level of hotels this tour company usually uses. When I arrived at the hotel there was newspapers and garbage right in front of the door and no one cared to clean it up for at least 2 days. It made a terrible impression when getting out of the cab. The room though large enough and clean enough was rather drab. We had breakfast in their restaurant Moxie's included in our stay and it was good. The location was good for walking to Gastown and the museum but you are at the end of Robson street and there was nothing but fast food restaurants on the street. Not at all close to the shopping area. Even the location was drab. I don't know what the price of this hotel is since it was included in our tour but I would look for a better hotel than this one.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: HerefordDrinker
Reviews.Content: This place has got to be the worst i have ever stayed in. The rooms were tatty,unclean,bathroom filthy and the staff were as much use as chocolate ash trays on motor bikes. Nothin going for it. NEVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not exactly great”
Reviews.Author: PaulFarnhamUK
Reviews.Content: Room was ok (Standard Room), but old beds and old bathroom. Also the Air con didn't work very well, so room was too warm (but it was unusually warm weather). Swimming Pool was terrible - very old and scruffy. Breakfast place was very good and very good value, also good for Lunch and Dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Waiting and waiting for the elevator”
Reviews.Author: gente
Reviews.Content: My family stayed with a group on our tour here for 2 days. It is a hotel with very many rooms but only 2 elevators. We waited for 15 minutes by the elevators when we arrived and on other occasions they were always packed with people also. The 3 persons room was not for 3 persons, but only for 2. There were only 2 towels and when we asked for more, we had to look for those towels ourselves in the TVcabinet. Although we asked for a breakfast at a normal time when we had a day of rest, we had to breakfast with the group at 7.00 AM. There were no spoons or knives enough. We will not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: SFTraveler11
Reviews.Content: I was staying here for a sporting competition with my team and had a horrible time. First, my roommate and I paid for 3 nights in a room with a queen sized bed, and got a double. Second, we were by a stairwell, which wouldn't ordinarily be a problem, except that the elevators are ridiculously small and slow and most people just decided to take the stairs... which had a loud and heavy door that banged as they exited. Thirdly, I only recall one shower with water temperature that was above luke warm, and when I was done my 5 minute shower, the water was back to lukewarm for my room mate. This was incredibly irritating when you want to clean off after a sweaty race. I felt colder after having showered. Oh and the fire alarm that went off at 1:45am on Sunday night was absolutely delightful too. Not that I could sleep much here on the other nights...

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: jennifer0001
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous because of some of the reviews. We had a perfect stay, start to finish. The front desk staff were very friendly and accomodating, the room was clean with a wonderful view of the water and downtown Vancouver, and it was walking distance to Gastown and Davie Street. The elevators were a bit small and slow; but, really, if that's the ONLY complaint about a hotel, they're doing SOMETHING right! I'd certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: loopyloo67
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night en route to Banff and had already paid for 2 nights before flying home. The hotel is very old and dated, the reception on the tv is hit and miss so don't bother paying for a movie. The tiny bathrooms need a good re-grout. Most of the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Last 2 nights we were "upgraded" to a king room which was no different just had a king bed with 2 mattresses on it. For the odd night its fine, a great Moxy's on site and the tram right outside - good for shopping. Good for an odd night but not for indulgence or a treat. Better area is nearer the tower.

Reviews.Title: “Ist Rate Service”
Reviews.Author: Happypat
Reviews.Content: We arrived after 10 hour flight from England exhausted but excited to be in Vancouver on our hols. Taxi from airport $24, pretty reasonable. Checking in was swift and staff very helpful, we were suprised when staff said we'd been given a up-grade, all the itinary we had was "double -room" from Travel Agent.Our up-grade was superb.....king size bed, suite with min-bar, huge bath-room....fantastic view, what a wonderful start to out holiday. We were up early next day exploring Vancouver, The harbour is a beautiful area in morning and we took aqua-bus to Granville Island,had brilliant day there (huge market) and fabulous lunch, sea-food platter ($30 for 2 !!). Nighttime we stayed in hotel and went to Sharks bar....we didn't stay long as it was crowded (big boxing match on TV). Next morning we went shopping, walked to Gas town (very touristy) extremely crowded. At night we went to chinese restaurant not far from Hotel.......another suberb meal half the price of England !!! ( boy were ripped off in England). Next morning we packed and had thoroughly enjoyed our stay in hotel and come back again...pity it was short......but the real purpose of our holiday just beginning....later that day were we going on cruise to Alaska for seven days....... and WOW what a holiday that was...............absolutly fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravellers07
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a total of 3 nights at the Sandman pre and post a coach tour. the hotel is very tired, the rooms are dark and the hotel is noisy. For our first night we were on the 5th floor and were kept awake most of the night by the sound of metal scraping on metal in the lift shaft (we were directly opposite the lifts), the ice machine and noise from the bar downstairs. we had just spent 3 nights at hampton inn one block away and to give you an idea of just how bad we thought the sandman was we tried to get a room at the hampton for our 2nd night even though we had paid for the sandman as part of our tour and would effectively be paying for 2 hotels, unfortunately the hampton inn was full but we did manage to change to the 7th floor for our 2nd night and were at least away from the lifts. we stayed again at the Sandman mid May, this time we were on the 8th floor so away from street and bar noise. There was a large group of people in wheelchairs staying at the hotel and there was a sign up requesting that people be patient as the lifts might be slower than normal due to the number of people using them (during our time at the sandman we found the lifts to be slow at the best of times). the morning we were to check out 1 of the lifts had people stuck in it which meant only 1 lift was operational. after waiting for a long time for the lift to arrive when it did turn up we found it was full of people riding up in order to go down again so we ended up having to carry our heavy suitcases down 8 floors. my overall impression of the Sandman was that it is dark, noisy and very tired, rooms were clean enough but very basic and the decor could do with being replaced, I would not stay there again and would definitely not recommend it. our travel agent had quoted for both sandman and hampton inn for our 3 nights pre tour and the hampton was substantially cheaper and i can not figure out why the sandman is dearer. given the choice i would pick the Hampton inn

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: navaro
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a one night stay at Sandman, the first night of a tour. Hotel better than expected as popular with tour groups. Good central location. Good view from room and plenty of space, no cooking facilities except coffee maker.On a main road so busy and a little noisy, especially on hockey nights at stadium very close. Ate at the restaurant. Food OK nothing spectacular. Much preferred Rosie's on Robson Street around the corner. Sandman is fine for a few days stay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: jh23_07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible. My boyfriend and I came to vancouver from the island to see a canucks game. We called 2 months before and booked a room with a queen size bed.Which we didn't get, instead 2 doubles. Friday night, we arrived late, woke in the morning to housekeeping, at 9am... then maintenance knocked half an hr later, we sent him away because we were sleeping, had a late night. Then half an hr later he came back! You could hear him drilling in the hallway since 8:45am!! Then saturday night went to the canucks game. Sunday morning we wake to so much noise in the morning, house keeping....again. The pop machine all night making noise. The Shark club below is loud at night, because it is in the same building. Sunday we checked out, walk to the underground, "SECURED" parking to go to my car... and found it had been broken into. stereo gone! 200.00 worth of clothing.. gone! Front desk didn't do much. Told them what happened they just handed us a form called a number for us to report the robbery. They weren't very helpfull at all. There is no security cameras, the gate opens for anyone, all u have to do is push the button to open it. There was no security guards anywhere, except when we checked out, there was a young man about early 20's standing behind the front desk! This is a horrible place! Do Not Stay here!!! Also talked to 3 other people who got broken into at the sandman the week before!! Oh and we had NO room service!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for hockey”
Reviews.Author: LargsEagle
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed at the Sandman in downtown Vancouver. Our reason for visiting the city was to watch the Vancouver Canucks ice hockey team. The hotel staff were all very helpful and professional in every way.The rooms were clean and well equipped/furnished. The sports bar "Sharks" was popular with guests and visitiors alike. The hotel was approx 3 mins walk to GM Place, home of the Canucks which meant not having to wrap up to attend games. It was also handy for all the shopping areas etc in the city. We never ate in the hotel but used a nearby diner called "Rickys" where an excelent b'fast could be had. I would have no problem recommending the Sandman to anyone but particularly would recommend to hockey fans for the convenience if nothing else. We will use the hotel again if we're back in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: missfogg
Reviews.Content: Stayed just 1 night at this hotel in Sep 06. Quite basic accommodation but happy with it for the price. Bathroom tiny and room smelt of cigarettes,was supposed to be non smoking - it came to light that there was a vent in the bathroom and this is where the smell was coming from. Has drinks machines on every floor. Lifts go wherever people press the button so you could end up spending the day going up and down the hotel so my advice would be to just use the stairs! Beds were clean, curtains were a horible red velvet and looked like they hadnt been cleaned since they were put there! Tv in all rooms Reception was tiny and had to wait a while to be checked in as this hotel is used for people on touring hoidays. Moxies restaurant on site, service quite slow but friendly. location is good, isnt really worth paying the extra $200 to stay in a better hotel as its more than likely going to be on the same block. Parking is also available for $10 per day. Be careful if out and about alone at night in this area, some unsavoury characters about!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Duckybean
Reviews.Content: Biggest pro about staying at this hotel was the staff. Despite being super busy at the time of check-in, the lady who recieved us was amazing. Sooo bubbly and energetic. She pointed out the best little haunts to visit, and funky places to eat. She went that extra step and spent time with us when it could have been so easy to just dismiss us as yet another number. Made us feel very special. Our room was quiet and snug. SUPER close to our concert hall. Amazing location. It was a quick jaunt across the street, and close to some great shopping too. Cons? The elevator was a bit slowish. Break out those leg muscles for the steps if you're in a rush! But really, the staff we encountered here are what will bring us back again given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Rate = Cheap Room”
Reviews.Author: angel000
Reviews.Content: We got a really awesome rate price, but a horrible room. I guess that is what happens at Sandman when you get a cheap rate they give you the cheap rooms. We had a nonsmoking room that smelled like old/rotten ash tray, our windows had MOLD all over them, our bathroom door had a huge whole in it from being kicked in, and we were placed right beside the elevators, and drunk people coming off of the elevator at all hours, and someone pulling the firealarm. After reading all the reviews on here I was very concered about all the BUG issue, so I contacted Sandman Inn and they offer me a complimentary upgrade, which they NEVER WENT THRU WITH. I think I will go back to the Holiday Inn

Reviews.Title: “Super!-What bed bugs!?”
Reviews.Author: madonnaboy
Reviews.Content: First of all-I stayed at this hotel, and I have never had a better expiernce! We checked into the hotel during a hockey night and it took us about 6-7 minutes to check in, but granted they had a huge line to check in, and all staff were going full tilt!
