I got to the desk, and the gentleman (i believe his name was Peter) was great-he got me upgraded to a king size bed for my anniversary-very impressive. We ate at the restaraunt upstairs (don't remember what it's called) and found it to be quite nice. I would certainly recommend this hotel and will deffinatly be back! Just a note about the comment earlier regarding bed bugs--If they would take the time to educate themselves on bed bugs, they would find that it has nothing to do with cleanliness of a room/house, and that all hotels from your basic hotel to 5 star hotel are affected by this (see the Province Paper-they did a story on this a couple of months ago!) Anyways-we had a great time and look forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: SussexBoyEast
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 2nd to the 12th October 2006. It was great, this was my first major holiday with my girlfriend and we loved it. Everything was clean, staff were polite and the rooms were comfortable! It had a good location i thought as everything was in easy walking distance of about 5 mins obviously depending on where u want to go! A big plus side for the hotel is that is has the Moxies Bar and Grill and the Shark Club Bar and Grill as these two were both extremely good for food and drink!! Of course if u wanted to venture out in the evening for a restaurant then u could but if u didnt want to, then all u had to do what go down a few levels from your room via the lift. The only very small complaint i had was that the windows were pretty thin so i could hear a lot of traffic at night but i would expect the higher your room the less you would hear! Besides your in the middle of a city so i didnt expect to have quiet traffic!!!! If i went to Vancouver again this would definitely be on my list of hotels to look at as its very reasonably priced and i liked its location! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: Misfit22
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel as it was the location of an out of town seminar. I would have chosen otherwise, and if I had realized how close the Hampton was to this I would have booked there and walked a block to the seminars/meetings I attended. The rooms are small, dark and cramped. The dark woodwork and wallpaper don't help the feeling of being cramped. Housekeeping was very sloppy, I could spot dust everywhere. The beds were hard and the measly pillows were foam. The bedding had definitely been around for a few years. The towels were skimpy and very very thin. I can't comment on the hotel's main restaurant, I never used it. There is a Shark's bar in the building and their food, drinks and service were outstanding. The hotel's catering was alright, nothing to write home about. This hotel is clearly used by tour companies, as you could see groups of travelers arriving enmass. Location, yes it's downtown - about one block from the library, but to get to the heart of downtown and the shopping districts and restaurants you're going to have to hoof it. The hotel's website calls the hotel "centrally located in the heart of downtown" NOT!! If you're traveling by yourself and don't like to walk the downtown streets at night (and yes there are homeless and beggars on your way to the main areas), you'll be captive to the hotel facilities. The hotel's website also states that they have fitness facilities, yet when I arrived I found that to be a separate business that was located in the hotel building. The hotel's guest information book stated to contact the front desk for pricing info to use those facilities. I would not recommend this hotel, and if you want to be in the heart of downtown Vancouver, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: CuriousGeorge77
Reviews.Content: Booked well in advance for a family of 5 vacation for a 4-night stay the long week-end in August, 2006. The rooms were small and cramped. We were initially given a room with one King size bed and a couch pull-out bed that could sleep only one person. The pull-out was filthy! The bedding had not been cleaned from a previous guest! The front desk personnel did not express any concern and were not very accomodating. The answer we were given when we expressed our concerns was that every hotel in Vancouver was booked and that was the best they could do. We requested a suite which we were finally provided on the second day, but not without some arm twisting. DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: sabrina_lane03
Reviews.Content: The sandman on west Georgia was horrific. It is at least 7 blocks from the heart of downtown. To get there you have to pass vacant spaces and numerous quantities of homeless people. It is within 2 blocks of a YMCA and a building for homeless people which explains why I passed those individuals. Once I checked in there was a drunk individual just standing in front of the elevator not moving. When I got off of the elevator I noticed that the hallway was just wide enough for my bag to roll through. The room was equally as small. The bed was only around four inches short of being as wide as the room. The walls however were the worst aspect. At 1AM I was woken up my drunk people outside of my room. From 2-2:45AM I was again woken up by the noises being made by the people in the next room --. I kept calling the front desk and was informed that I could switch rooms if I wanted to. However, when I was checking out that morning, why should I be required to move. The front desk should have called that room and explained to the occupants that the room was paper thin.

Reviews.Title: “December 10, Andre Rieu Concert”
Reviews.Author: szszszszsz
Reviews.Content: I booked a room 1 year in advance, it was for Saturday, and with two functions happening that night it was booked solid. I called about 1 week ahead and thought I would book two nights, they wanted more money for the Friday, so I declined. When we arrived the line ups were rediculous , the parking signs were for 15 minutes for check-in, check in took about 30 minutes, then they had given up my room, I made it very clear that I was very angry they offered a smoking room for a few dollars less. The room stunk, it was on the street side, and only 3 floors from road noise, drunk patrons leaving the bar below, and yelling , doors slamming until about 0230. If you must stay here, they suggested to call and check but don't let the hotel say date and #of nights, but tell them yourself, get the name of the person you are speaking with.
